values.name: IN_FLIGHT
values.description: Payment is still in flight.

values.name: SUCCEEDED
values.description: Payment completed successfully.

values.name: FAILED_TIMEOUT
values.description: There are more routes to try, but the payment timeout was exceeded.

values.name: FAILED_NO_ROUTE
values.description:
All possible routes were tried and failed permanently. Or were no
routes to the destination at all.

values.name: FAILED_ERROR
values.description: A non-recoverable error has occurred.

values.name: FAILED_INCORRECT_PAYMENT_DETAILS
values.description:
Payment details incorrect (unknown hash, invalid amt or
invalid final cltv delta)

values.name: FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_BALANCE
values.description: Insufficient local balance.

fields.name: amt_msat
fields.description:
The amount to send expressed in msat. If set to zero, the minimum routable
amount is used.

fields.name: final_cltv_delta
fields.description:
CLTV delta from the current height that should be used for the timelock
of the final hop

fields.name: outgoing_chan_id
fields.description:
The channel id of the channel that must be taken to the first hop. If zero,
any channel may be used.

fields.name: hop_pubkeys
fields.description:
A list of hops that defines the route. This does not include the source hop
pubkey.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: payment_addr
fields.description: An optional payment addr to be included within the last hop of the route.

fields.name: route
fields.description: Fully specified route that can be used to execute the payment.

fields.name: chan_id
fields.description: The id of the channel that the is part of this circuit.

fields.name: htlc_id
fields.description: The index of the incoming htlc in the incoming channel.

fields.name: info
fields.description: Info contains details about the htlc that was forwarded.

fields.name: incoming_circuit_key
fields.description:
The key of this forwarded htlc. It defines the incoming channel id and
the index in this channel.

fields.name: incoming_amount_msat
fields.description: The incoming htlc amount.

fields.name: incoming_expiry
fields.description: The incoming htlc expiry.

fields.name: payment_hash
fields.description:
The htlc payment hash. This value is not guaranteed to be unique per
request.

fields.name: outgoing_requested_chan_id
fields.description:
The requested outgoing channel id for this forwarded htlc. Because of
non-strict forwarding, this isn't necessarily the channel over which the
packet will be forwarded eventually. A different channel to the same peer
may be selected as well.

fields.name: outgoing_amount_msat
fields.description: The outgoing htlc amount.

fields.name: outgoing_expiry
fields.description: The outgoing htlc expiry.

fields.name: custom_records
fields.description: Any custom records that were present in the payload.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: onion_blob
fields.description: The onion blob for the next hop

messages.name: ForwardHtlcInterceptResponse
messages.description:
ForwardHtlcInterceptResponse enables the caller to resolve a previously hold
forward. The caller can choose either to:
- `Resume`: Execute the default behavior (usually forward).
- `Reject`: Fail the htlc backwards.
- `Settle`: Settle this htlc with a given preimage.

fields.name: incoming_circuit_key
fields.description:
The key of this forwarded htlc. It defines the incoming channel id and
the index in this channel.

fields.name: action
fields.description: The resolve action for this intercepted htlc.

fields.name: preimage
fields.description: The preimage in case the resolve action is Settle.

fields.name: failure_message
fields.description:
Encrypted failure message in case the resolve action is Fail.

If failure_message is specified, the failure_code field must be set
to zero.

fields.name: failure_code
fields.description:
Return the specified failure code in case the resolve action is Fail. The
message data fields are populated automatically.

If a non-zero failure_code is specified, failure_message must not be set.

For backwards-compatibility reasons, TEMPORARY_CHANNEL_FAILURE is the
default value for this field.

fields.name: config
fields.description: Mission control's currently active config.

messages.name: HtlcEvent
messages.description:
HtlcEvent contains the htlc event that was processed. These are served on a
best-effort basis; events are not persisted, delivery is not guaranteed
(in the event of a crash in the switch, forward events may be lost) and
some events may be replayed upon restart. Events consumed from this package
should be de-duplicated by the htlc's unique combination of incoming and
outgoing channel id and htlc id. [EXPERIMENTAL]

fields.name: incoming_channel_id
fields.description:
The short channel id that the incoming htlc arrived at our node on. This
value is zero for sends.

fields.name: outgoing_channel_id
fields.description:
The short channel id that the outgoing htlc left our node on. This value
is zero for receives.

fields.name: incoming_htlc_id
fields.description:
Incoming id is the index of the incoming htlc in the incoming channel.
This value is zero for sends.

fields.name: outgoing_htlc_id
fields.description:
Outgoing id is the index of the outgoing htlc in the outgoing channel.
This value is zero for receives.

fields.name: timestamp_ns
fields.description: The time in unix nanoseconds that the event occurred.

fields.name: event_type
fields.description:
The event type indicates whether the htlc was part of a send, receive or
forward.

fields.name: incoming_timelock
fields.description: The timelock on the incoming htlc.

fields.name: outgoing_timelock
fields.description: The timelock on the outgoing htlc.

fields.name: incoming_amt_msat
fields.description: The amount of the incoming htlc.

fields.name: outgoing_amt_msat
fields.description: The amount of the outgoing htlc.

fields.name: info
fields.description: Info contains details about the htlc that we failed.

fields.name: wire_failure
fields.description: FailureCode is the BOLT error code for the failure.

fields.name: failure_detail
fields.description:
FailureDetail provides additional information about the reason for the
failure. This detail enriches the information provided by the wire message
and may be 'no detail' if the wire message requires no additional metadata.

fields.name: failure_string
fields.description: A string representation of the link failure.

fields.name: half_life_seconds
fields.description:
The amount of time mission control will take to restore a penalized node
or channel back to 50% success probability, expressed in seconds. Setting
this value to a higher value will penalize failures for longer, making
mission control less likely to route through nodes and channels that we
have previously recorded failures for.

fields.name: hop_probability
fields.description:
The probability of success mission control should assign to hop in a route
where it has no other information available. Higher values will make mission
control more willing to try hops that we have no information about, lower
values will discourage trying these hops.

fields.name: weight
fields.description:
The importance that mission control should place on historical results,
expressed as a value in [0;1]. Setting this value to 1 will ignore all
historical payments and just use the hop probability to assess the
probability of success for each hop. A zero value ignores hop probability
completely and relies entirely on historical results, unless none are
available.

fields.name: maximum_payment_results
fields.description: The maximum number of payment results that mission control will store.

fields.name: minimum_failure_relax_interval
fields.description:
The minimum time that must have passed since the previously recorded failure
before we raise the failure amount.

fields.name: fail_time
fields.description: Time of last failure.

fields.name: fail_amt_sat
fields.description:
Lowest amount that failed to forward rounded to whole sats. This may be
set to zero if the failure is independent of amount.

fields.name: fail_amt_msat
fields.description:
Lowest amount that failed to forward in millisats. This may be
set to zero if the failure is independent of amount.

fields.name: success_time
fields.description: Time of last success.

fields.name: success_amt_sat
fields.description: Highest amount that we could successfully forward rounded to whole sats.

fields.name: success_amt_msat
fields.description: Highest amount that we could successfully forward in millisats.

messages.name: PairHistory
messages.description: PairHistory contains the mission control state for a particular node pair.

fields.name: node_from
fields.description: The source node pubkey of the pair.

fields.name: node_to
fields.description: The destination node pubkey of the pair.

fields.name: state
fields.description: Current state the payment is in.

fields.name: preimage
fields.description: The pre-image of the payment when state is SUCCEEDED.

fields.name: htlcs
fields.description: The HTLCs made in attempt to settle the payment [EXPERIMENTAL].
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: pairs
fields.description: Node pair-level mission control state.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: from_node
fields.description: The source node pubkey of the pair.

fields.name: to_node
fields.description: The destination node pubkey of the pair.

fields.name: amt_msat
fields.description: The amount for which to calculate a probability.

fields.name: probability
fields.description: The success probability for the requested pair.

fields.name: history
fields.description: The historical data for the requested pair.

fields.name: dest
fields.description: The destination once wishes to obtain a routing fee quote to.

fields.name: amt_sat
fields.description: The amount one wishes to send to the target destination.

fields.name: routing_fee_msat
fields.description:
A lower bound of the estimated fee to the target destination within the
network, expressed in milli-satoshis.

fields.name: time_lock_delay
fields.description:
An estimate of the worst case time delay that can occur. Note that callers
will still need to factor in the final CLTV delta of the last hop into this
value.

fields.name: dest
fields.description: The identity pubkey of the payment recipient

fields.name: amt
fields.description:
Number of satoshis to send.

The fields amt and amt_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: amt_msat
fields.description:
Number of millisatoshis to send.

The fields amt and amt_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: payment_hash
fields.description: The hash to use within the payment's HTLC

fields.name: final_cltv_delta
fields.description:
The CLTV delta from the current height that should be used to set the
timelock for the final hop.

fields.name: payment_addr
fields.description: An optional payment addr to be included within the last hop of the route.

fields.name: payment_request
fields.description:
A bare-bones invoice for a payment within the Lightning Network.  With the
details of the invoice, the sender has all the data necessary to send a
payment to the recipient. The amount in the payment request may be zero. In
that case it is required to set the amt field as well. If no payment request
is specified, the following fields are required: dest, amt and payment_hash.

fields.name: timeout_seconds
fields.description:
An upper limit on the amount of time we should spend when attempting to
fulfill the payment. This is expressed in seconds. If we cannot make a
successful payment within this time frame, an error will be returned.
This field must be non-zero.

fields.name: fee_limit_sat
fields.description:
The maximum number of satoshis that will be paid as a fee of the payment.
If this field is left to the default value of 0, only zero-fee routes will
be considered. This usually means single hop routes connecting directly to
the destination. To send the payment without a fee limit, use max int here.

The fields fee_limit_sat and fee_limit_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: fee_limit_msat
fields.description:
The maximum number of millisatoshis that will be paid as a fee of the
payment. If this field is left to the default value of 0, only zero-fee
routes will be considered. This usually means single hop routes connecting
directly to the destination. To send the payment without a fee limit, use
max int here.

The fields fee_limit_sat and fee_limit_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: outgoing_chan_id
fields.description:
Deprecated, use outgoing_chan_ids. The channel id of the channel that must
be taken to the first hop. If zero, any channel may be used (unless
outgoing_chan_ids are set).

fields.name: outgoing_chan_ids
fields.description:
The channel ids of the channels are allowed for the first hop. If empty,
any channel may be used.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: last_hop_pubkey
fields.description: The pubkey of the last hop of the route. If empty, any hop may be used.

fields.name: cltv_limit
fields.description:
An optional maximum total time lock for the route. This should not exceed
lnd's `--max-cltv-expiry` setting. If zero, then the value of
`--max-cltv-expiry` is enforced.

fields.name: route_hints
fields.description: Optional route hints to reach the destination through private channels.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: dest_custom_records
fields.description:
An optional field that can be used to pass an arbitrary set of TLV records
to a peer which understands the new records. This can be used to pass
application specific data during the payment attempt. Record types are
required to be in the custom range >= 65536. When using REST, the values
must be encoded as base64.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: allow_self_payment
fields.description: If set, circular payments to self are permitted.

fields.name: dest_features
fields.description:
Features assumed to be supported by the final node. All transitive feature
dependencies must also be set properly. For a given feature bit pair, either
optional or remote may be set, but not both. If this field is nil or empty,
the router will try to load destination features from the graph as a
fallback.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: max_parts
fields.description:
The maximum number of partial payments that may be use to complete the full
amount.

fields.name: no_inflight_updates
fields.description:
If set, only the final payment update is streamed back. Intermediate updates
that show which htlcs are still in flight are suppressed.

fields.name: max_shard_size_msat
fields.description:
The largest payment split that should be attempted when making a payment if
splitting is necessary. Setting this value will effectively cause lnd to
split more aggressively, vs only when it thinks it needs to. Note that this
value is in milli-satoshis.

fields.name: amp
fields.description: If set, an AMP-payment will be attempted.

fields.name: time_pref
fields.description:
The time preference for this payment. Set to -1 to optimize for fees
only, to 1 to optimize for reliability only or a value inbetween for a mix.

fields.name: payment_hash
fields.description: The payment hash to use for the HTLC.

fields.name: route
fields.description: Route that should be used to attempt to complete the payment.

fields.name: skip_temp_err
fields.description:
Whether the payment should be marked as failed when a temporary error is
returned from the given route. Set it to true so the payment won't be
failed unless a terminal error is occurred, such as payment timeout, no
routes, incorrect payment details, or insufficient funds.

fields.name: preimage
fields.description: The preimage obtained by making the payment.

fields.name: failure
fields.description: The failure message in case the payment failed.

fields.name: config
fields.description:
The config to set for mission control. Note that all values *must* be set,
because the full config will be applied.

fields.name: preimage
fields.description: The revealed preimage.

fields.name: payment_hash
fields.description: The hash of the payment to look up.

fields.name: no_inflight_updates
fields.description:
If set, only the final payment update is streamed back. Intermediate updates
that show which htlcs are still in flight are suppressed.

fields.name: pairs
fields.description: Node pair-level mission control state to be imported.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: force
fields.description:
Whether to force override MC pair history. Note that even with force
override the failure pair is imported before the success pair and both
still clamp existing failure/success amounts.

allows users to specify a full route manually. This can be used for

methods.name: HtlcInterceptor
methods.description:
HtlcInterceptor dispatches a bi-directional streaming RPC in which
Forwarded HTLC requests are sent to the client and the client responds with
a boolean that tells LND if this htlc should be intercepted.
In case of interception, the htlc can be either settled, cancelled or
resumed later by using the ResolveHoldForward endpoint.

parameters.description: (streaming inputs)
parameters.name: body

details.summary:
*
HtlcInterceptor dispatches a bi-directional streaming RPC in which
Forwarded HTLC requests are sent to the client and the client responds with
a boolean that tells LND if this htlc should be intercepted.
In case of interception, the htlc can be either settled, cancelled or
resumed later by using the ResolveHoldForward endpoint.

methods.name: UpdateChanStatus
methods.description:
UpdateChanStatus attempts to manually set the state of a channel
(enabled, disabled, or auto). A manual "disable" request will cause the
channel to stay disabled until a subsequent manual request of either
"enable" or "auto".

details.summary:
UpdateChanStatus attempts to manually set the state of a channel
(enabled, disabled, or auto). A manual "disable" request will cause the
channel to stay disabled until a subsequent manual request of either
"enable" or "auto".

values.name: DEFAULT
values.description: The default look up modifier, no look up behavior is changed.

values.name: HTLC_SET_ONLY
values.description:
Indicates that when a look up is done based on a set_id, then only that set
of HTLCs related to that set ID should be returned.

values.name: HTLC_SET_BLANK
values.description:
Indicates that when a look up is done using a payment_addr, then no HTLCs
related to the payment_addr should be returned. This is useful when one
wants to be able to obtain the set of associated setIDs with a given
invoice, then look up the sub-invoices "projected" by that set ID.

fields.name: memo
fields.description:
An optional memo to attach along with the invoice. Used for record keeping
purposes for the invoice's creator, and will also be set in the description
field of the encoded payment request if the description_hash field is not
being used.

fields.name: hash
fields.description: The hash of the preimage

fields.name: value
fields.description:
The value of this invoice in satoshis

The fields value and value_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: value_msat
fields.description:
The value of this invoice in millisatoshis

The fields value and value_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: description_hash
fields.description:
Hash (SHA-256) of a description of the payment. Used if the description of
payment (memo) is too long to naturally fit within the description field
of an encoded payment request.

fields.name: expiry
fields.description: Payment request expiry time in seconds. Default is 3600 (1 hour).

fields.name: fallback_addr
fields.description: Fallback on-chain address.

fields.name: cltv_expiry
fields.description: Delta to use for the time-lock of the CLTV extended to the final hop.

fields.name: route_hints
fields.description:
Route hints that can each be individually used to assist in reaching the
invoice's destination.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: private
fields.description: Whether this invoice should include routing hints for private channels.

fields.name: payment_request
fields.description:
A bare-bones invoice for a payment within the Lightning Network. With the
details of the invoice, the sender has all the data necessary to send a
payment to the recipient.

fields.name: add_index
fields.description:
The "add" index of this invoice. Each newly created invoice will increment
this index making it monotonically increasing. Callers to the
SubscribeInvoices call can use this to instantly get notified of all added
invoices with an add_index greater than this one.

fields.name: payment_addr
fields.description:
The payment address of the generated invoice. This value should be used
in all payments for this invoice as we require it for end to end
security.

fields.name: payment_hash
fields.description:
Hash corresponding to the (hold) invoice to cancel. When using
REST, this field must be encoded as base64.

fields.name: payment_hash
fields.description: When using REST, this field must be encoded as base64.

fields.name: preimage
fields.description:
Externally discovered pre-image that should be used to settle the hold
invoice.

fields.name: r_hash
fields.description:
Hash corresponding to the (hold) invoice to subscribe to. When using
REST, this field must be encoded as base64url.

enums.name: AddressType
enums.description:
`AddressType` has to be one of:

- `p2wkh`: Pay to witness key hash (`WITNESS_PUBKEY_HASH` = 0)
- `np2wkh`: Pay to nested witness key hash (`NESTED_PUBKEY_HASH` = 1)
- `p2tr`: Pay to taproot pubkey (`TAPROOT_PUBKEY` = 4)

values.name: UNKNOWN_COMMITMENT_TYPE
values.description: Returned when the commitment type isn't known or unavailable.

values.name: LEGACY
values.description:
A channel using the legacy commitment format having tweaked to_remote
keys.

values.name: STATIC_REMOTE_KEY
values.description:
A channel that uses the modern commitment format where the key in the
output of the remote party does not change each state. This makes back
up and recovery easier as when the channel is closed, the funds go
directly to that key.

values.name: ANCHORS
values.description:
A channel that uses a commitment format that has anchor outputs on the
commitments, allowing fee bumping after a force close transaction has
been broadcast.

values.name: SCRIPT_ENFORCED_LEASE
values.description:
A channel that uses a commitment type that builds upon the anchors
commitment format, but in addition requires a CLTV clause to spend outputs
paying to the channel initiator. This is intended for use on leased channels
to guarantee that the channel initiator has no incentives to close a leased
channel before its maturity date.

values.name: RESERVED
values.description:
The numbers assigned in this enumeration match the failure codes as
defined in BOLT #4. Because protobuf 3 requires enums to start with 0,
a RESERVED value is added.

values.name: INTERNAL_FAILURE
values.description: An internal error occurred.

values.name: UNKNOWN_FAILURE
values.description: The error source is known, but the failure itself couldn't be decoded.

values.name: UNREADABLE_FAILURE
values.description:
An unreadable failure result is returned if the received failure message
cannot be decrypted. In that case the error source is unknown.

values.name: FAILURE_REASON_NONE
values.description: Payment isn't failed (yet).

values.name: FAILURE_REASON_TIMEOUT
values.description: There are more routes to try, but the payment timeout was exceeded.

values.name: FAILURE_REASON_NO_ROUTE
values.description:
All possible routes were tried and failed permanently. Or were no
routes to the destination at all.

values.name: FAILURE_REASON_ERROR
values.description: A non-recoverable error has occured.

values.name: FAILURE_REASON_INCORRECT_PAYMENT_DETAILS
values.description:
Payment details incorrect (unknown hash, invalid amt or
invalid final cltv delta)

values.name: FAILURE_REASON_INSUFFICIENT_BALANCE
values.description: Insufficient local balance.

values.name: UNKNOWN_SYNC
values.description: Denotes that we cannot determine the peer's current sync type.

values.name: ACTIVE_SYNC
values.description: Denotes that we are actively receiving new graph updates from the peer.

values.name: PASSIVE_SYNC
values.description: Denotes that we are not receiving new graph updates from the peer.

values.name: PINNED_SYNC
values.description: Denotes that this peer is pinned into an active sync.

values.name: OUTCOME_UNKNOWN
values.description: Outcome unknown.

values.name: CLAIMED
values.description: An output was claimed on chain.

values.name: UNCLAIMED
values.description: An output was left unclaimed on chain.

values.name: ABANDONED
values.description:
ResolverOutcomeAbandoned indicates that an output that we did not
claim on chain, for example an anchor that we did not sweep and a
third party claimed on chain, or a htlc that we could not decode
so left unclaimed.

values.name: FIRST_STAGE
values.description:
If we force closed our channel, our htlcs need to be claimed in two
stages. This outcome represents the broadcast of a timeout or success
transaction for this two stage htlc claim.

values.name: TIMEOUT
values.description: A htlc was timed out on chain.

values.name: ANCHOR
values.description: We resolved an anchor output.

values.name: INCOMING_HTLC
values.description:
We are resolving an incoming htlc on chain. This if this htlc is
claimed, we swept the incoming htlc with the preimage. If it is timed
out, our peer swept the timeout path.

values.name: OUTGOING_HTLC
values.description:
We are resolving an outgoing htlc on chain. If this htlc is claimed,
the remote party swept the htlc with the preimage. If it is timed out,
we swept it with the timeout path.

values.name: COMMIT
values.description: We force closed and need to sweep our time locked commitment output.

fields.name: root_share
fields.description:
An n-of-n secret share of the root seed from which child payment hashes
and preimages are derived.

fields.name: set_id
fields.description: An identifier for the HTLC set that this HTLC belongs to.

fields.name: child_index
fields.description:
A nonce used to randomize the child preimage and child hash from a given
root_share.

fields.name: hash
fields.description: The payment hash of the AMP HTLC.

fields.name: preimage
fields.description:
The preimage used to settle this AMP htlc. This field will only be
populated if the invoice is in InvoiceState_ACCEPTED or
InvoiceState_SETTLED.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state the HTLCs associated with this setID are in.

fields.name: settle_index
fields.description: The settle index of this HTLC set, if the invoice state is settled.

fields.name: settle_time
fields.description: The time this HTLC set was settled expressed in unix epoch.

fields.name: amt_paid_msat
fields.description: The total amount paid for the sub-invoice expressed in milli satoshis.

fields.name: i_know_what_i_am_doing
fields.description:
Override the requirement for being in dev mode by setting this to true and
confirming the user knows what they are doing and this is a potential foot
gun to lose funds if used on active channels.

fields.name: payment_request
fields.description:
A bare-bones invoice for a payment within the Lightning Network. With the
details of the invoice, the sender has all the data necessary to send a
payment to the recipient.

fields.name: add_index
fields.description:
The "add" index of this invoice. Each newly created invoice will increment
this index making it monotonically increasing. Callers to the
SubscribeInvoices call can use this to instantly get notified of all added
invoices with an add_index greater than this one.

fields.name: payment_addr
fields.description:
The payment address of the generated invoice. This value should be used
in all payments for this invoice as we require it for end to end
security.

fields.name: sat
fields.description: Value denominated in satoshis.

fields.name: msat
fields.description: Value denominated in milli-satoshis.

fields.name: permissions
fields.description: The list of permissions the new macaroon should grant.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: root_key_id
fields.description: The root key ID used to create the macaroon, must be a positive integer.

fields.name: allow_external_permissions
fields.description:
Informs the RPC on whether to allow external permissions that LND is not
aware of.

fields.name: macaroon
fields.description: The hex encoded macaroon, serialized in binary format.

fields.name: node_pubkey
fields.description:
The pubkey of the node to open a channel with. When using REST, this
field must be encoded as base64.

fields.name: local_funding_amount
fields.description: The number of satoshis the wallet should commit to the channel.

fields.name: push_sat
fields.description:
The number of satoshis to push to the remote side as part of the initial
commitment state.

fields.name: private
fields.description:
Whether this channel should be private, not announced to the greater
network.

fields.name: min_htlc_msat
fields.description:
The minimum value in millisatoshi we will require for incoming HTLCs on
the channel.

fields.name: remote_csv_delay
fields.description:
The delay we require on the remote's commitment transaction. If this is
not set, it will be scaled automatically with the channel size.

fields.name: close_address
fields.description:
Close address is an optional address which specifies the address to which
funds should be paid out to upon cooperative close. This field may only be
set if the peer supports the option upfront feature bit (call listpeers
to check). The remote peer will only accept cooperative closes to this
address if it is set.

Note: If this value is set on channel creation, you will *not* be able to
cooperatively close out to a different address.

fields.name: pending_chan_id
fields.description:
An optional, unique identifier of 32 random bytes that will be used as the
pending channel ID to identify the channel while it is in the pre-pending
state.

fields.name: commitment_type
fields.description:
The explicit commitment type to use. Note this field will only be used if
the remote peer supports explicit channel negotiation.

fields.name: channels
fields.description: The list of channels to open.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: target_conf
fields.description:
The target number of blocks that the funding transaction should be
confirmed by.

fields.name: sat_per_vbyte
fields.description:
A manual fee rate set in sat/vByte that should be used when crafting the
funding transaction.

fields.name: min_confs
fields.description:
The minimum number of confirmations each one of your outputs used for
the funding transaction must satisfy.

fields.name: spend_unconfirmed
fields.description:
Whether unconfirmed outputs should be used as inputs for the funding
transaction.

fields.name: label
fields.description: An optional label for the batch transaction, limited to 500 characters.

fields.name: chain
fields.description: The blockchain the node is on (eg bitcoin, litecoin)

fields.name: network
fields.description: The network the node is on (eg regtest, testnet, mainnet)

fields.name: single_chan_backups
fields.description:
The set of new channels that have been added since the last channel backup
snapshot was requested.

fields.name: multi_chan_backup
fields.description:
A multi-channel backup that covers all open channels currently known to
lnd.

fields.name: chan_id
fields.description:
The unique channel ID for the channel. The first 3 bytes are the block
height, the next 3 the index within the block, and the last 2 bytes are the
output index for the channel.

fields.name: amt
fields.description:
The size of the pre-crafted output to be used as the channel point for this
channel funding.

fields.name: chan_point
fields.description: The target channel point to refrence in created commitment transactions.

fields.name: local_key
fields.description: Our local key to use when creating the multi-sig output.

fields.name: remote_key
fields.description: The key of the remote party to use when creating the multi-sig output.

fields.name: pending_chan_id
fields.description:
If non-zero, then this will be used as the pending channel ID on the wire
protocol to initate the funding request. This is an optional field, and
should only be set if the responder is already expecting a specific pending
channel ID.

fields.name: thaw_height
fields.description:
This uint32 indicates if this channel is to be considered 'frozen'. A frozen
channel does not allow a cooperative channel close by the initiator. The
thaw_height is the height that this restriction stops applying to the
channel. The height can be interpreted in two ways: as a relative height if
the value is less than 500,000, or as an absolute height otherwise.

fields.name: active
fields.description: Whether this channel is active or not

fields.name: remote_pubkey
fields.description: The identity pubkey of the remote node

fields.name: channel_point
fields.description:
The outpoint (txid:index) of the funding transaction. With this value, Bob
will be able to generate a signature for Alice's version of the commitment
transaction.

fields.name: chan_id
fields.description:
The unique channel ID for the channel. The first 3 bytes are the block
height, the next 3 the index within the block, and the last 2 bytes are the
output index for the channel.

fields.name: capacity
fields.description: The total amount of funds held in this channel

fields.name: local_balance
fields.description: This node's current balance in this channel

fields.name: remote_balance
fields.description: The counterparty's current balance in this channel

fields.name: commit_fee
fields.description:
The amount calculated to be paid in fees for the current set of commitment
transactions. The fee amount is persisted with the channel in order to
allow the fee amount to be removed and recalculated with each channel state
update, including updates that happen after a system restart.

fields.name: commit_weight
fields.description: The weight of the commitment transaction

fields.name: fee_per_kw
fields.description:
The required number of satoshis per kilo-weight that the requester will pay
at all times, for both the funding transaction and commitment transaction.
This value can later be updated once the channel is open.

fields.name: unsettled_balance
fields.description: The unsettled balance in this channel

fields.name: total_satoshis_sent
fields.description: The total number of satoshis we've sent within this channel.

fields.name: total_satoshis_received
fields.description: The total number of satoshis we've received within this channel.

fields.name: num_updates
fields.description: The total number of updates conducted within this channel.

fields.name: pending_htlcs
fields.description: The list of active, uncleared HTLCs currently pending within the channel.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: csv_delay
fields.description:
Deprecated. The CSV delay expressed in relative blocks. If the channel is
force closed, we will need to wait for this many blocks before we can regain
our funds.

fields.name: private
fields.description: Whether this channel is advertised to the network or not.

fields.name: initiator
fields.description: True if we were the ones that created the channel.

fields.name: chan_status_flags
fields.description: A set of flags showing the current state of the channel.

fields.name: local_chan_reserve_sat
fields.description:
Deprecated. The minimum satoshis this node is required to reserve in its
balance.

fields.name: remote_chan_reserve_sat
fields.description:
Deprecated. The minimum satoshis the other node is required to reserve in
its balance.

fields.name: static_remote_key
fields.description: Deprecated. Use commitment_type.

fields.name: commitment_type
fields.description: The commitment type used by this channel.

fields.name: lifetime
fields.description:
The number of seconds that the channel has been monitored by the channel
scoring system. Scores are currently not persisted, so this value may be
less than the lifetime of the channel [EXPERIMENTAL].

fields.name: uptime
fields.description:
The number of seconds that the remote peer has been observed as being online
by the channel scoring system over the lifetime of the channel
[EXPERIMENTAL].

fields.name: close_address
fields.description:
Close address is the address that we will enforce payout to on cooperative
close if the channel was opened utilizing option upfront shutdown. This
value can be set on channel open by setting close_address in an open channel
request. If this value is not set, you can still choose a payout address by
cooperatively closing with the delivery_address field set.

fields.name: push_amount_sat
fields.description:
The amount that the initiator of the channel optionally pushed to the remote
party on channel open. This amount will be zero if the channel initiator did
not push any funds to the remote peer. If the initiator field is true, we
pushed this amount to our peer, if it is false, the remote peer pushed this
amount to us.

fields.name: thaw_height
fields.description:
This uint32 indicates if this channel is to be considered 'frozen'. A
frozen channel doest not allow a cooperative channel close by the
initiator. The thaw_height is the height that this restriction stops
applying to the channel. This field is optional, not setting it or using a
value of zero will mean the channel has no additional restrictions. The
height can be interpreted in two ways: as a relative height if the value is
less than 500,000, or as an absolute height otherwise.

fields.name: local_constraints
fields.description: List constraints for the local node.

fields.name: remote_constraints
fields.description: List constraints for the remote node.

fields.name: node_pubkey
fields.description: The pubkey of the node that wishes to open an inbound channel.

fields.name: chain_hash
fields.description: The hash of the genesis block that the proposed channel resides in.

fields.name: pending_chan_id
fields.description: The pending channel id.

fields.name: funding_amt
fields.description:
The funding amount in satoshis that initiator wishes to use in the
channel.

fields.name: push_amt
fields.description: The push amount of the proposed channel in millisatoshis.

fields.name: dust_limit
fields.description: The dust limit of the initiator's commitment tx.

fields.name: max_value_in_flight
fields.description:
The maximum amount of coins in millisatoshis that can be pending in this
channel.

fields.name: channel_reserve
fields.description:
The minimum amount of satoshis the initiator requires us to have at all
times.

fields.name: min_htlc
fields.description: The smallest HTLC in millisatoshis that the initiator will accept.

fields.name: fee_per_kw
fields.description:
The initial fee rate that the initiator suggests for both commitment
transactions.

fields.name: csv_delay
fields.description:
The number of blocks to use for the relative time lock in the pay-to-self
output of both commitment transactions.

fields.name: max_accepted_htlcs
fields.description: The total number of incoming HTLC's that the initiator will accept.

fields.name: channel_flags
fields.description:
A bit-field which the initiator uses to specify proposed channel
behavior.

fields.name: commitment_type
fields.description: The commitment type the initiator wishes to use for the proposed channel.

fields.name: accept
fields.description: Whether or not the client accepts the channel.

fields.name: pending_chan_id
fields.description: The pending channel id to which this response applies.

fields.name: error
fields.description:
An optional error to send the initiating party to indicate why the channel
was rejected. This field *should not* contain sensitive information, it will
be sent to the initiating party. This field should only be set if accept is
false, the channel will be rejected if an error is set with accept=true
because the meaning of this response is ambiguous. Limited to 500
characters.

fields.name: upfront_shutdown
fields.description:
The upfront shutdown address to use if the initiating peer supports option
upfront shutdown script (see ListPeers for the features supported). Note
that the channel open will fail if this value is set for a peer that does
not support this feature bit.

fields.name: csv_delay
fields.description: The csv delay (in blocks) that we require for the remote party.

fields.name: reserve_sat
fields.description:
The reserve amount in satoshis that we require the remote peer to adhere to.
We require that the remote peer always have some reserve amount allocated to
them so that there is always a disincentive to broadcast old state (if they
hold 0 sats on their side of the channel, there is nothing to lose).

fields.name: in_flight_max_msat
fields.description:
The maximum amount of funds in millisatoshis that we allow the remote peer
to have in outstanding htlcs.

fields.name: max_htlc_count
fields.description: The maximum number of htlcs that the remote peer can offer us.

fields.name: min_htlc_in
fields.description: The minimum value in millisatoshis for incoming htlcs on the channel.

fields.name: min_accept_depth
fields.description: The number of confirmations we require before we consider the channel open.

fields.name: zero_conf
fields.description:
Whether the responder wants this to be a zero-conf channel. This will fail
if either side does not have the scid-alias feature bit set. The minimum
depth field must be zero if this is true.

fields.name: chan_point
fields.description: Identifies the channel that this backup belongs to.

fields.name: chan_backup
fields.description:
Is an encrypted single-chan backup. this can be passed to
RestoreChannelBackups, or the WalletUnlocker Init and Unlock methods in
order to trigger the recovery protocol. When using REST, this field must be
encoded as base64.

fields.name: chan_backups
fields.description: A set of single-chan static channel backups.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: balance
fields.description: Deprecated. Sum of channels balances denominated in satoshis

fields.name: pending_open_balance
fields.description: Deprecated. Sum of channels pending balances denominated in satoshis

fields.name: local_balance
fields.description: Sum of channels local balances.

fields.name: remote_balance
fields.description: Sum of channels remote balances.

fields.name: unsettled_local_balance
fields.description: Sum of channels local unsettled balances.

fields.name: unsettled_remote_balance
fields.description: Sum of channels remote unsettled balances.

fields.name: pending_open_local_balance
fields.description: Sum of channels pending local balances.

fields.name: pending_open_remote_balance
fields.description: Sum of channels pending remote balances.

fields.name: channel_point
fields.description: The outpoint (txid:index) of the funding transaction.

fields.name: chan_id
fields.description: The unique channel ID for the channel.

fields.name: chain_hash
fields.description: The hash of the genesis block that this channel resides within.

fields.name: closing_tx_hash
fields.description: The txid of the transaction which ultimately closed this channel.

fields.name: remote_pubkey
fields.description: Public key of the remote peer that we formerly had a channel with.

fields.name: capacity
fields.description: Total capacity of the channel.

fields.name: close_height
fields.description: Height at which the funding transaction was spent.

fields.name: settled_balance
fields.description: Settled balance at the time of channel closure

fields.name: time_locked_balance
fields.description: The sum of all the time-locked outputs at the time of channel closure

fields.name: close_type
fields.description: Details on how the channel was closed.

fields.name: open_initiator
fields.description:
Open initiator is the party that initiated opening the channel. Note that
this value may be unknown if the channel was closed before we migrated to
store open channel information after close.

fields.name: close_initiator
fields.description:
Close initiator indicates which party initiated the close. This value will
be unknown for channels that were cooperatively closed before we started
tracking cooperative close initiators. Note that this indicates which party
initiated a close, and it is possible for both to initiate cooperative or
force closes, although only one party's close will be confirmed on chain.

fields.name: csv_delay
fields.description:
The CSV delay expressed in relative blocks. If the channel is force closed,
we will need to wait for this many blocks before we can regain our funds.

fields.name: chan_reserve_sat
fields.description: The minimum satoshis this node is required to reserve in its balance.

fields.name: dust_limit_sat
fields.description: The dust limit (in satoshis) of the initiator's commitment tx.

fields.name: max_pending_amt_msat
fields.description:
The maximum amount of coins in millisatoshis that can be pending in this
channel.

fields.name: min_htlc_msat
fields.description: The smallest HTLC in millisatoshis that the initiator will accept.

fields.name: max_accepted_htlcs
fields.description: The total number of incoming HTLC's that the initiator will accept.

messages.name: ChannelEdge
messages.description:
A fully authenticated channel along with all its unique attributes.
Once an authenticated channel announcement has been processed on the network,
then an instance of ChannelEdgeInfo encapsulating the channels attributes is
stored. The other portions relevant to routing policy of a channel are stored
within a ChannelEdgePolicy for each direction of the channel.

fields.name: channel_id
fields.description:
The unique channel ID for the channel. The first 3 bytes are the block
height, the next 3 the index within the block, and the last 2 bytes are the
output index for the channel.

fields.name: chan_id
fields.description:
The unique channel ID for the channel. The first 3 bytes are the block
height, the next 3 the index within the block, and the last 2 bytes are the
output index for the channel.

fields.name: chan_id
fields.description: The short channel id that this fee report belongs to.

fields.name: channel_point
fields.description: The channel that this fee report belongs to.

fields.name: base_fee_msat
fields.description: The base fee charged regardless of the number of milli-satoshis sent.

fields.name: fee_per_mil
fields.description:
The amount charged per milli-satoshis transferred expressed in
millionths of a satoshi.

fields.name: fee_rate
fields.description:
The effective fee rate in milli-satoshis. Computed by dividing the
fee_per_mil value by 1 million.

messages.name: ChannelGraph
messages.description: Returns a new instance of the directed channel graph.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: The list of `LightningNode`s in this channel graph
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: edges
fields.description: The list of `ChannelEdge`s in this channel graph
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: include_unannounced
fields.description:
Whether unannounced channels are included in the response or not. If set,
unannounced channels are included. Unannounced channels are both private
channels, and public channels that are not yet announced to the network.

fields.name: funding_txid_bytes
fields.description:
Txid of the funding transaction. When using REST, this field must be
encoded as base64.

fields.name: funding_txid_str
fields.description:
Hex-encoded string representing the byte-reversed hash of the funding
transaction.

fields.name: output_index
fields.description: The index of the output of the funding transaction

fields.name: signature
fields.description:
The signature that validates the announced data and proves the ownership
of node id.

fields.name: chain_hash
fields.description:
The target chain that this channel was opened within. This value
should be the genesis hash of the target chain. Along with the short
channel ID, this uniquely identifies the channel globally in a
blockchain.

fields.name: chan_id
fields.description: The unique description of the funding transaction.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description:
A timestamp that allows ordering in the case of multiple announcements.
We should ignore the message if timestamp is not greater than the
last-received.

fields.name: message_flags
fields.description:
The bitfield that describes whether optional fields are present in this
update. Currently, the least-significant bit must be set to 1 if the
optional field MaxHtlc is present.

fields.name: channel_flags
fields.description:
The bitfield that describes additional meta-data concerning how the
update is to be interpreted. Currently, the least-significant bit must be
set to 0 if the creating node corresponds to the first node in the
previously sent channel announcement and 1 otherwise. If the second bit
is set, then the channel is set to be disabled.

fields.name: time_lock_delta
fields.description:
The minimum number of blocks this node requires to be added to the expiry
of HTLCs. This is a security parameter determined by the node operator.
This value represents the required gap between the time locks of the
incoming and outgoing HTLC's set to this node.

fields.name: htlc_minimum_msat
fields.description: The minimum HTLC value which will be accepted.

fields.name: base_fee
fields.description:
The base fee that must be used for incoming HTLC's to this particular
channel. This value will be tacked onto the required for a payment
independent of the size of the payment.

fields.name: fee_rate
fields.description: The fee rate that will be charged per millionth of a satoshi.

fields.name: htlc_maximum_msat
fields.description: The maximum HTLC value which will be accepted.

fields.name: extra_opaque_data
fields.description:
The set of data that was appended to this message, some of which we may
not actually know how to iterate or parse. By holding onto this data, we
ensure that we're able to properly validate the set of signatures that
cover these new fields, and ensure we're able to make upgrades to the
network in a forwards compatible manner.

fields.name: channel_point
fields.description:
The outpoint (txid:index) of the funding transaction. With this value, Bob
will be able to generate a signature for Alice's version of the commitment
transaction.

fields.name: force
fields.description:
If true, then the channel will be closed forcibly. This means the
current commitment transaction will be signed and broadcast.

fields.name: target_conf
fields.description:
The target number of blocks that the closure transaction should be
confirmed by.

fields.name: sat_per_byte
fields.description:
Deprecated, use sat_per_vbyte.
A manual fee rate set in sat/vbyte that should be used when crafting the
closure transaction.

fields.name: delivery_address
fields.description:
An optional address to send funds to in the case of a cooperative close.
If the channel was opened with an upfront shutdown script and this field
is set, the request to close will fail because the channel must pay out
to the upfront shutdown addresss.

fields.name: sat_per_vbyte
fields.description:
A manual fee rate set in sat/vbyte that should be used when crafting the
closure transaction.

fields.name: chan_id
fields.description:
The unique channel ID for the channel. The first 3 bytes are the block
height, the next 3 the index within the block, and the last 2 bytes are the
output index for the channel.

fields.name: addr
fields.description: Lightning address of the peer to connect to.

fields.name: perm
fields.description:
If set, the daemon will attempt to persistently connect to the target
peer. Otherwise, the call will be synchronous.

fields.name: timeout
fields.description:
The connection timeout value (in seconds) for this request. It won't affect
other requests.

fields.name: peer
fields.description: Peer from which the message originates

fields.name: type
fields.description: Message type. This value will be in the custom range (>= 32768).

fields.name: data
fields.description: Raw message data

fields.name: failed_payments_only
fields.description: Only delete failed payments.

fields.name: failed_htlcs_only
fields.description: Only delete failed HTLCs from payments, not the payment itself.

fields.name: root_key_id
fields.description: The root key ID to be removed.

fields.name: deleted
fields.description: A boolean indicates that the deletion is successful.

fields.name: payment_hash
fields.description: Payment hash to delete.

fields.name: failed_htlcs_only
fields.description: Only delete failed HTLCs from the payment, not the payment itself.

fields.name: pub_key
fields.description: The pubkey of the node to disconnect from

fields.name: channel_id
fields.description: The short channel id of this edge.

fields.name: direction_reverse
fields.description:
The direction of this edge. If direction_reverse is false, the direction
of this edge is from the channel endpoint with the lexicographically smaller
pub key to the endpoint with the larger pub key. If direction_reverse is
is true, the edge goes the other way.

fields.name: AddrToAmount
fields.description: The map from addresses to amounts for the transaction.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: target_conf
fields.description:
The target number of blocks that this transaction should be confirmed
by.

fields.name: min_confs
fields.description:
The minimum number of confirmations each one of your outputs used for
the transaction must satisfy.

fields.name: spend_unconfirmed
fields.description: Whether unconfirmed outputs should be used as inputs for the transaction.

fields.name: fee_sat
fields.description: The total fee in satoshis.

fields.name: feerate_sat_per_byte
fields.description:
Deprecated, use sat_per_vbyte.
The fee rate in satoshi/vbyte.

fields.name: sat_per_vbyte
fields.description: The fee rate in satoshi/vbyte.

fields.name: chan_point
fields.description: The target channel point to obtain a back up for.

fields.name: outpoint
fields.description: The outpoint in format txid:n

fields.name: reason
fields.description: Reason for the policy update failure.

fields.name: update_error
fields.description: A string representation of the policy update error.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Failure code as defined in the Lightning spec

fields.name: channel_update
fields.description: An optional channel update message.

fields.name: htlc_msat
fields.description: A failure type-dependent htlc value.

fields.name: onion_sha_256
fields.description: The sha256 sum of the onion payload.

fields.name: cltv_expiry
fields.description: A failure type-dependent cltv expiry value.

fields.name: flags
fields.description: A failure type-dependent flags value.

fields.name: failure_source_index
fields.description:
The position in the path of the intermediate or final node that generated
the failure message. Position zero is the sender node.

fields.name: height
fields.description: A failure type-dependent block height.

fields.name: fixed
fields.description:
The fee limit expressed as a fixed amount of satoshis.

The fields fixed and fixed_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: fixed_msat
fields.description:
The fee limit expressed as a fixed amount of millisatoshis.

The fields fixed and fixed_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: percent
fields.description: The fee limit expressed as a percentage of the payment amount.

fields.name: channel_fees
fields.description:
An array of channel fee reports which describes the current fee schedule
for each channel.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: day_fee_sum
fields.description:
The total amount of fee revenue (in satoshis) the switch has collected
over the past 24 hrs.

fields.name: week_fee_sum
fields.description:
The total amount of fee revenue (in satoshis) the switch has collected
over the past 1 week.

fields.name: month_fee_sum
fields.description:
The total amount of fee revenue (in satoshis) the switch has collected
over the past 1 month.

fields.name: value
fields.description: Arbitrary float value.

fields.name: normalized_value
fields.description: The value normalized to [0,1] or [-1,1].

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description:
Timestamp is the time (unix epoch offset) that this circuit was
completed. Deprecated by timestamp_ns.

fields.name: chan_id_in
fields.description: The incoming channel ID that carried the HTLC that created the circuit.

fields.name: chan_id_out
fields.description:
The outgoing channel ID that carried the preimage that completed the
circuit.

fields.name: amt_in
fields.description:
The total amount (in satoshis) of the incoming HTLC that created half
the circuit.

fields.name: amt_out
fields.description:
The total amount (in satoshis) of the outgoing HTLC that created the
second half of the circuit.

fields.name: fee
fields.description: The total fee (in satoshis) that this payment circuit carried.

fields.name: fee_msat
fields.description: The total fee (in milli-satoshis) that this payment circuit carried.

fields.name: amt_in_msat
fields.description:
The total amount (in milli-satoshis) of the incoming HTLC that created
half the circuit.

fields.name: amt_out_msat
fields.description:
The total amount (in milli-satoshis) of the outgoing HTLC that created
the second half of the circuit.

fields.name: timestamp_ns
fields.description:
The number of nanoseconds elapsed since January 1, 1970 UTC when this
circuit was completed.

fields.name: start_time
fields.description:
Start time is the starting point of the forwarding history request. All
records beyond this point will be included, respecting the end time, and
the index offset.

fields.name: end_time
fields.description:
End time is the end point of the forwarding history request. The
response will carry at most 50k records between the start time and the
end time. The index offset can be used to implement pagination.

fields.name: index_offset
fields.description:
Index offset is the offset in the time series to start at. As each
response can only contain 50k records, callers can use this to skip
around within a packed time series.

fields.name: num_max_events
fields.description: The max number of events to return in the response to this query.

fields.name: forwarding_events
fields.description:
A list of forwarding events from the time slice of the time series
specified in the request.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: last_offset_index
fields.description:
The index of the last time in the set of returned forwarding events. Can
be used to seek further, pagination style.

fields.name: signed_psbt
fields.description:
The funded PSBT that contains all witness data to send the exact channel
capacity amount to the PK script returned in the open channel message in a
previous step. Cannot be set at the same time as final_raw_tx.

fields.name: pending_chan_id
fields.description: The pending channel ID of the channel to get the PSBT for.

fields.name: final_raw_tx
fields.description:
As an alternative to the signed PSBT with all witness data, the final raw
wire format transaction can also be specified directly. Cannot be set at the
same time as signed_psbt.

fields.name: funded_psbt
fields.description:
The funded but not yet signed PSBT that sends the exact channel capacity
amount to the PK script returned in the open channel message in a previous
step.

fields.name: pending_chan_id
fields.description: The pending channel ID of the channel to get the PSBT for.

fields.name: skip_finalize
fields.description:
Can only be used if the no_publish flag was set to true in the OpenChannel
call meaning that the caller is solely responsible for publishing the final
funding transaction. If skip_finalize is set to true then lnd will not wait
for a FundingPsbtFinalize state step and instead assumes that a transaction
with the same TXID as the passed in PSBT will eventually confirm.
IT IS ABSOLUTELY IMPERATIVE that the TXID of the transaction that is
eventually published does have the _same TXID_ as the verified PSBT. That
means no inputs or outputs can change, only signatures can be added. If the
TXID changes between this call and the publish step then the channel will
never be created and the funds will be in limbo.

fields.name: chan_point_shim
fields.description:
A channel shim where the channel point was fully constructed outside
of lnd's wallet and the transaction might already be published.

fields.name: psbt_shim
fields.description:
A channel shim that uses a PSBT to fund and sign the channel funding
transaction.

fields.name: pending_chan_id
fields.description: The pending channel ID of the channel to cancel the funding shim for.

fields.name: shim_register
fields.description:
The funding shim to register. This should be used before any
channel funding has began by the remote party, as it is intended as a
preparatory step for the full channel funding.

fields.name: shim_cancel
fields.description: Used to cancel an existing registered funding shim.

fields.name: psbt_verify
fields.description:
Used to continue a funding flow that was initiated to be executed
through a PSBT. This step verifies that the PSBT contains the correct
outputs to fund the channel.

fields.name: psbt_finalize
fields.description:
Used to continue a funding flow that was initiated to be executed
through a PSBT. This step finalizes the funded and signed PSBT, finishes
negotiation with the peer and finally publishes the resulting funding
transaction.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version of the LND software that the node is running.

fields.name: commit_hash
fields.description: The SHA1 commit hash that the daemon is compiled with.

fields.name: identity_pubkey
fields.description: The identity pubkey of the current node.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: If applicable, the alias of the current node, e.g. "bob"

fields.name: color
fields.description: The color of the current node in hex code format

fields.name: num_pending_channels
fields.description: Number of pending channels

fields.name: num_active_channels
fields.description: Number of active channels

fields.name: num_inactive_channels
fields.description: Number of inactive channels

fields.name: num_peers
fields.description: Number of peers

fields.name: block_height
fields.description: The node's current view of the height of the best block

fields.name: block_hash
fields.description: The node's current view of the hash of the best block

fields.name: best_header_timestamp
fields.description: Timestamp of the block best known to the wallet

fields.name: synced_to_chain
fields.description: Whether the wallet's view is synced to the main chain

fields.name: synced_to_graph
fields.description: Whether we consider ourselves synced with the public channel graph.

fields.name: testnet
fields.description:
Whether the current node is connected to testnet. This field is
deprecated and the network field should be used instead

fields.name: chains
fields.description: A list of active chains the node is connected to
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: uris
fields.description: The URIs of the current node.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: features
fields.description:
Features that our node has advertised in our init message, node
announcements and invoices.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: require_htlc_interceptor
fields.description: Indicates whether the HTLC interceptor API is in always-on mode.

fields.name: recovery_mode
fields.description: Whether the wallet is in recovery mode

fields.name: recovery_finished
fields.description: Whether the wallet recovery progress is finished

fields.name: progress
fields.description: The recovery progress, ranging from 0 to 1.

fields.name: start_height
fields.description:
The height from which to list transactions, inclusive. If this value is
greater than end_height, transactions will be read in reverse.

fields.name: end_height
fields.description:
The height until which to list transactions, inclusive. To include
unconfirmed transactions, this value should be set to -1, which will
return transactions from start_height until the current chain tip and
unconfirmed transactions. If no end_height is provided, the call will
default to this option.

fields.name: account
fields.description: An optional filter to only include transactions relevant to an account.

fields.name: htlc_index
fields.description: Index identifying the htlc on the channel.

fields.name: forwarding_channel
fields.description:
If this HTLC is involved in a forwarding operation, this field indicates
the forwarding channel. For an outgoing htlc, it is the incoming channel.
For an incoming htlc, it is the outgoing channel. When the htlc
originates from this node or this node is the final destination,
forwarding_channel will be zero. The forwarding channel will also be zero
for htlcs that need to be forwarded but don't have a forwarding decision
persisted yet.

fields.name: forwarding_htlc_index
fields.description: Index identifying the htlc on the forwarding channel.

fields.name: attempt_id
fields.description: The unique ID that is used for this attempt.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the HTLC.

fields.name: route
fields.description: The route taken by this HTLC.

fields.name: attempt_time_ns
fields.description: The time in UNIX nanoseconds at which this HTLC was sent.

fields.name: resolve_time_ns
fields.description:
The time in UNIX nanoseconds at which this HTLC was settled or failed.
This value will not be set if the HTLC is still IN_FLIGHT.

fields.name: failure
fields.description: Detailed htlc failure info.

fields.name: preimage
fields.description: The preimage that was used to settle the HTLC.

fields.name: chan_id
fields.description:
The unique channel ID for the channel. The first 3 bytes are the block
height, the next 3 the index within the block, and the last 2 bytes are the
output index for the channel.

fields.name: pub_key
fields.description:
An optional public key of the hop. If the public key is given, the payment
can be executed without relying on a copy of the channel graph.

fields.name: tlv_payload
fields.description:
If set to true, then this hop will be encoded using the new variable length
TLV format. Note that if any custom tlv_records below are specified, then
this field MUST be set to true for them to be encoded properly.

fields.name: mpp_record
fields.description:
An optional TLV record that signals the use of an MPP payment. If present,
the receiver will enforce that the same mpp_record is included in the final
hop payload of all non-zero payments in the HTLC set. If empty, a regular
single-shot payment is or was attempted.

fields.name: amp_record
fields.description:
An optional TLV record that signals the use of an AMP payment. If present,
the receiver will treat all received payments including the same
(payment_addr, set_id) pair  as being part of one logical payment. The
payment will be settled by XORing the root_share's together and deriving the
child hashes and preimages according to BOLT XX. Must be used in conjunction
with mpp_record.

fields.name: custom_records
fields.description:
An optional set of key-value TLV records. This is useful within the context
of the SendToRoute call as it allows callers to specify arbitrary K-V pairs
to drop off at each hop within the onion.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: The payment metadata to send along with the payment to the payee.

fields.name: node_id
fields.description: The public key of the node at the start of the channel.

fields.name: chan_id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the channel.

fields.name: fee_base_msat
fields.description: The base fee of the channel denominated in millisatoshis.

fields.name: fee_proportional_millionths
fields.description:
The fee rate of the channel for sending one satoshi across it denominated in
millionths of a satoshi.

fields.name: cltv_expiry_delta
fields.description: The time-lock delta of the channel.

fields.name: error
fields.description:
The error to return to the user. If this is non-empty, the incoming gRPC
stream/request is aborted and the error is returned to the gRPC client. If
this value is empty, it means the middleware accepts the stream/request/
response and the processing of it can continue.

fields.name: replace_response
fields.description:
A boolean indicating that the gRPC message should be replaced/overwritten.
This boolean is needed because in protobuf an empty message is serialized as
a 0-length or nil byte slice and we wouldn't be able to distinguish between
an empty replacement message and the "don't replace anything" case.

fields.name: replacement_serialized
fields.description:
If the replace_response field is set to true, this field must contain the
binary serialized gRPC message in the protobuf format.

fields.name: memo
fields.description:
An optional memo to attach along with the invoice. Used for record keeping
purposes for the invoice's creator, and will also be set in the description
field of the encoded payment request if the description_hash field is not
being used.

fields.name: r_preimage
fields.description:
The hex-encoded preimage (32 byte) which will allow settling an incoming
HTLC payable to this preimage. When using REST, this field must be encoded
as base64.

fields.name: r_hash
fields.description:
The hash of the preimage. When using REST, this field must be encoded as
base64.
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.

fields.name: value
fields.description:
The value of this invoice in satoshis

The fields value and value_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: value_msat
fields.description:
The value of this invoice in millisatoshis

The fields value and value_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: settled
fields.description: Whether this invoice has been fulfilled

fields.name: creation_date
fields.description:
When this invoice was created.
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.

fields.name: settle_date
fields.description:
When this invoice was settled.
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.

fields.name: payment_request
fields.description:
A bare-bones invoice for a payment within the Lightning Network. With the
details of the invoice, the sender has all the data necessary to send a
payment to the recipient.
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.

fields.name: description_hash
fields.description:
Hash (SHA-256) of a description of the payment. Used if the description of
payment (memo) is too long to naturally fit within the description field
of an encoded payment request. When using REST, this field must be encoded
as base64.

fields.name: expiry
fields.description: Payment request expiry time in seconds. Default is 3600 (1 hour).

fields.name: fallback_addr
fields.description: Fallback on-chain address.

fields.name: cltv_expiry
fields.description: Delta to use for the time-lock of the CLTV extended to the final hop.

fields.name: route_hints
fields.description:
Route hints that can each be individually used to assist in reaching the
invoice's destination.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: private
fields.description: Whether this invoice should include routing hints for private channels.

fields.name: add_index
fields.description:
The "add" index of this invoice. Each newly created invoice will increment
this index making it monotonically increasing. Callers to the
SubscribeInvoices call can use this to instantly get notified of all added
invoices with an add_index greater than this one.
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.

fields.name: settle_index
fields.description:
The "settle" index of this invoice. Each newly settled invoice will
increment this index making it monotonically increasing. Callers to the
SubscribeInvoices call can use this to instantly get notified of all
settled invoices with an settle_index greater than this one.
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.

fields.name: amt_paid
fields.description: Deprecated, use amt_paid_sat or amt_paid_msat.

fields.name: amt_paid_sat
fields.description:
The amount that was accepted for this invoice, in satoshis. This will ONLY
be set if this invoice has been settled. We provide this field as if the
invoice was created with a zero value, then we need to record what amount
was ultimately accepted. Additionally, it's possible that the sender paid
MORE that was specified in the original invoice. So we'll record that here
as well.
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.

fields.name: amt_paid_msat
fields.description:
The amount that was accepted for this invoice, in millisatoshis. This will
ONLY be set if this invoice has been settled. We provide this field as if
the invoice was created with a zero value, then we need to record what
amount was ultimately accepted. Additionally, it's possible that the sender
paid MORE that was specified in the original invoice. So we'll record that
here as well.
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.

fields.name: state
fields.description:
The state the invoice is in.
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.

fields.name: htlcs
fields.description:
List of HTLCs paying to this invoice [EXPERIMENTAL].
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: features
fields.description:
List of features advertised on the invoice.
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: is_keysend
fields.description:
Indicates if this invoice was a spontaneous payment that arrived via keysend
[EXPERIMENTAL].
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.

fields.name: payment_addr
fields.description:
The payment address of this invoice. This value will be used in MPP
payments, and also for newer invoices that always require the MPP payload
for added end-to-end security.
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.

fields.name: is_amp
fields.description: Signals whether or not this is an AMP invoice.

fields.name: amp_invoice_state
fields.description:
[EXPERIMENTAL]:

Maps a 32-byte hex-encoded set ID to the sub-invoice AMP state for the
given set ID. This field is always populated for AMP invoices, and can be
used along side LookupInvoice to obtain the HTLC information related to a
given sub-invoice.
Note: Output only, don't specify for creating an invoice.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: InvoiceHTLC
messages.description: Details of an HTLC that paid to an invoice

fields.name: chan_id
fields.description: Short channel id over which the htlc was received.

fields.name: htlc_index
fields.description: Index identifying the htlc on the channel.

fields.name: amt_msat
fields.description: The amount of the htlc in msat.

fields.name: accept_height
fields.description: Block height at which this htlc was accepted.

fields.name: accept_time
fields.description: Time at which this htlc was accepted.

fields.name: resolve_time
fields.description: Time at which this htlc was settled or canceled.

fields.name: expiry_height
fields.description: Block height at which this htlc expires.

fields.name: state
fields.description: Current state the htlc is in.

fields.name: custom_records
fields.description: Custom tlv records.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: mpp_total_amt_msat
fields.description: The total amount of the mpp payment in msat.

fields.name: amp
fields.description: Details relevant to AMP HTLCs, only populated if this is an AMP HTLC.

fields.name: add_index
fields.description:
If specified (non-zero), then we'll first start by sending out
notifications for all added indexes with an add_index greater than this
value. This allows callers to catch up on any events they missed while they
weren't connected to the streaming RPC.

fields.name: settle_index
fields.description:
If specified (non-zero), then we'll first start by sending out
notifications for all settled indexes with an settle_index greater than
this value. This allows callers to catch up on any events they missed while
they weren't connected to the streaming RPC.

fields.name: raw_key_bytes
fields.description: The raw bytes of the key being identified.

fields.name: key_loc
fields.description: The key locator that identifies which key to use for signing.

fields.name: key_family
fields.description: The family of key being identified.

fields.name: key_index
fields.description: The precise index of the key being identified.

fields.name: pubkey
fields.description: The identity pubkey of the Lightning node.

fields.name: host
fields.description:
The network location of the lightning node, e.g. `69.69.69.69:1337` or
`localhost:10011`.

messages.name: LightningNode
messages.description:
An individual vertex/node within the channel graph. A node is
connected to other nodes by one or more channel edges emanating from it. As the
graph is directed, a node will also have an incoming edge attached to it for
each outgoing edge.

fields.name: peer
fields.description:
Filters the response for channels with a target peer's pubkey. If peer is
empty, all channels will be returned.

fields.name: channels
fields.description: The list of active channels
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: pending_only
fields.description:
If set, only invoices that are not settled and not canceled will be returned
in the response.

fields.name: index_offset
fields.description:
The index of an invoice that will be used as either the start or end of a
query to determine which invoices should be returned in the response.

fields.name: num_max_invoices
fields.description: The max number of invoices to return in the response to this query.

fields.name: reversed
fields.description:
If set, the invoices returned will result from seeking backwards from the
specified index offset. This can be used to paginate backwards.

fields.name: invoices
fields.description:
A list of invoices from the time slice of the time series specified in the
request.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: last_index_offset
fields.description:
The index of the last item in the set of returned invoices. This can be used
to seek further, pagination style.

fields.name: first_index_offset
fields.description:
The index of the last item in the set of returned invoices. This can be used
to seek backwards, pagination style.

fields.name: root_key_ids
fields.description: The list of root key IDs that are in use.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: include_incomplete
fields.description:
If true, then return payments that have not yet fully completed. This means
that pending payments, as well as failed payments will show up if this
field is set to true. This flag doesn't change the meaning of the indices,
which are tied to individual payments.

fields.name: index_offset
fields.description:
The index of a payment that will be used as either the start or end of a
query to determine which payments should be returned in the response. The
index_offset is exclusive. In the case of a zero index_offset, the query
will start with the oldest payment when paginating forwards, or will end
with the most recent payment when paginating backwards.

fields.name: max_payments
fields.description: The maximal number of payments returned in the response to this query.

fields.name: reversed
fields.description:
If set, the payments returned will result from seeking backwards from the
specified index offset. This can be used to paginate backwards. The order
of the returned payments is always oldest first (ascending index order).

fields.name: count_total_payments
fields.description:
If set, all payments (complete and incomplete, independent of the
max_payments parameter) will be counted. Note that setting this to true will
