increase the run time of the call significantly on systems that have a lot
of payments, as all of them have to be iterated through to be counted.

fields.name: payments
fields.description: The list of payments
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: first_index_offset
fields.description:
The index of the first item in the set of returned payments. This can be
used as the index_offset to continue seeking backwards in the next request.

fields.name: last_index_offset
fields.description:
The index of the last item in the set of returned payments. This can be used
as the index_offset to continue seeking forwards in the next request.

fields.name: total_num_payments
fields.description:
Will only be set if count_total_payments in the request was set. Represents
the total number of payments (complete and incomplete, independent of the
number of payments requested in the query) currently present in the payments
database.

fields.name: latest_error
fields.description:
If true, only the last error that our peer sent us will be returned with
the peer's information, rather than the full set of historic errors we have
stored.

fields.name: peers
fields.description: The list of currently connected peers
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: method_permissions
fields.description:
A map between all RPC method URIs and their required macaroon permissions to
access them.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: min_confs
fields.description: The minimum number of confirmations to be included.

fields.name: max_confs
fields.description: The maximum number of confirmations to be included.

fields.name: account
fields.description: An optional filter to only include outputs belonging to an account.

fields.name: utxos
fields.description: A list of utxos
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: payment_addr
fields.description:
A unique, random identifier used to authenticate the sender as the intended
payer of a multi-path payment. The payment_addr must be the same for all
subpayments, and match the payment_addr provided in the receiver's invoice.
The same payment_addr must be used on all subpayments.

fields.name: total_amt_msat
fields.description:
The total amount in milli-satoshis being sent as part of a larger multi-path
payment. The caller is responsible for ensuring subpayments to the same node
and payment_hash sum exactly to total_amt_msat. The same
total_amt_msat must be used on all subpayments.

fields.name: entity
fields.description: The entity a permission grants access to.

fields.name: action
fields.description: The action that is granted.

fields.name: permissions
fields.description: A list of macaroon permissions.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: middleware_name
fields.description:
The name of the middleware to register. The name should be as informative
as possible and is logged on registration.

fields.name: custom_macaroon_caveat_name
fields.description:
The name of the custom macaroon caveat that this middleware is responsible
for. Only requests/responses that contain a macaroon with the registered
custom caveat are forwarded for interception to the middleware. The
exception being the read-only mode: All requests/responses are forwarded to
a middleware that requests read-only access but such a middleware won't be
allowed to _alter_ responses. As a security measure, _no_ middleware can
change responses to requests made with _unencumbered_ macaroons!
NOTE: Cannot be used at the same time as read_only_mode.

fields.name: read_only_mode
fields.description:
Instead of defining a custom macaroon caveat name a middleware can register
itself for read-only access only. In that mode all requests/responses are
forwarded to the middleware but the middleware isn't allowed to alter any of
the responses.
NOTE: Cannot be used at the same time as custom_macaroon_caveat_name.

fields.name: chan_points
fields.description: Is the set of all channels that are included in this multi-channel backup.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: multi_chan_backup
fields.description:
A single encrypted blob containing all the static channel backups of the
channel listed above. This can be stored as a single file or blob, and
safely be replaced with any prior/future versions. When using REST, this
field must be encoded as base64.

fields.name: num_zombie_chans
fields.description: The number of edges marked as zombies.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of address to generate.

fields.name: account
fields.description:
The name of the account to generate a new address for. If empty, the
default wallet account is used.

fields.name: address
fields.description: The newly generated wallet address

fields.name: node
fields.description:
An individual vertex/node within the channel graph. A node is
connected to other nodes by one or more channel edges emanating from it. As
the graph is directed, a node will also have an incoming edge attached to
it for each outgoing edge.

fields.name: num_channels
fields.description: The total number of channels for the node.

fields.name: total_capacity
fields.description: The sum of all channels capacity for the node, denominated in satoshis.

fields.name: channels
fields.description: A list of all public channels for the node.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: pub_key
fields.description: The 33-byte hex-encoded compressed public of the target node

fields.name: include_channels
fields.description: If true, will include all known channels associated with the node.

fields.name: types
fields.description: The requested node metrics.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: betweenness_centrality
fields.description:
Betweenness centrality is the sum of the ratio of shortest paths that pass
through the node for each pair of nodes in the graph (not counting paths
starting or ending at this node).
Map of node pubkey to betweenness centrality of the node. Normalized
values are in the [0,1] closed interval.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: from
fields.description:
The sending node of the pair. When using REST, this field must be encoded as
base64.

fields.name: to
fields.description:
The receiving node of the pair. When using REST, this field must be encoded
as base64.

fields.name: addresses
fields.description: Deprecated, use node_addresses.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: global_features
fields.description: Deprecated, use features.

fields.name: features
fields.description:
Features that the node has advertised in the init message, node
announcements and invoices.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: sat_per_vbyte
fields.description:
A manual fee rate set in sat/vbyte that should be used when crafting the
funding transaction.

fields.name: node_pubkey
fields.description:
The pubkey of the node to open a channel with. When using REST, this field
must be encoded as base64.

fields.name: node_pubkey_string
fields.description:
The hex encoded pubkey of the node to open a channel with. Deprecated now
that the REST gateway supports base64 encoding of bytes fields.

fields.name: local_funding_amount
fields.description: The number of satoshis the wallet should commit to the channel

fields.name: push_sat
fields.description:
The number of satoshis to push to the remote side as part of the initial
commitment state

fields.name: target_conf
fields.description:
The target number of blocks that the funding transaction should be
confirmed by.

fields.name: sat_per_byte
fields.description:
Deprecated, use sat_per_vbyte.
A manual fee rate set in sat/vbyte that should be used when crafting the
funding transaction.

fields.name: private
fields.description:
Whether this channel should be private, not announced to the greater
network.

fields.name: min_htlc_msat
fields.description:
The minimum value in millisatoshi we will require for incoming HTLCs on
the channel.

fields.name: remote_csv_delay
fields.description:
The delay we require on the remote's commitment transaction. If this is
not set, it will be scaled automatically with the channel size.

fields.name: min_confs
fields.description:
The minimum number of confirmations each one of your outputs used for
the funding transaction must satisfy.

fields.name: spend_unconfirmed
fields.description:
Whether unconfirmed outputs should be used as inputs for the funding
transaction.

fields.name: close_address
fields.description:
Close address is an optional address which specifies the address to which
funds should be paid out to upon cooperative close. This field may only be
set if the peer supports the option upfront feature bit (call listpeers
to check). The remote peer will only accept cooperative closes to this
address if it is set.

Note: If this value is set on channel creation, you will *not* be able to
cooperatively close out to a different address.

fields.name: funding_shim
fields.description:
Funding shims are an optional argument that allow the caller to intercept
certain funding functionality. For example, a shim can be provided to use a
particular key for the commitment key (ideally cold) rather than use one
that is generated by the wallet as normal, or signal that signing will be
carried out in an interactive manner (PSBT based).

fields.name: remote_max_value_in_flight_msat
fields.description:
The maximum amount of coins in millisatoshi that can be pending within
the channel. It only applies to the remote party.

fields.name: remote_max_htlcs
fields.description:
The maximum number of concurrent HTLCs we will allow the remote party to add
to the commitment transaction.

fields.name: max_local_csv
fields.description:
Max local csv is the maximum csv delay we will allow for our own commitment
transaction.

fields.name: commitment_type
fields.description:
The explicit commitment type to use. Note this field will only be used if
the remote peer supports explicit channel negotiation.

fields.name: zero_conf
fields.description: If this is true, then a zero-conf channel open will be attempted.

fields.name: scid_alias
fields.description:
If this is true, then an option-scid-alias channel-type open will be
attempted.

fields.name: chan_pending
fields.description:
Signals that the channel is now fully negotiated and the funding
transaction published.

fields.name: chan_open
fields.description:
Signals that the channel's funding transaction has now reached the
required number of confirmations on chain and can be used.

fields.name: psbt_fund
fields.description:
Signals that the funding process has been suspended and the construction
of a PSBT that funds the channel PK script is now required.

fields.name: pending_chan_id
fields.description:
The pending channel ID of the created channel. This value may be used to
further the funding flow manually via the FundingStateStep method.

fields.name: txid_bytes
fields.description: Raw bytes representing the transaction id.

fields.name: txid_str
fields.description: Reversed, hex-encoded string representing the transaction id.

fields.name: output_index
fields.description: The index of the output on the transaction.

fields.name: output_type
fields.description: The type of the output

fields.name: address
fields.description: The address

fields.name: pk_script
fields.description: The pkscript in hex

fields.name: output_index
fields.description: The output index used in the raw transaction

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The value of the output coin in satoshis

fields.name: is_our_address
fields.description: Denotes if the output is controlled by the internal wallet

fields.name: pay_req
fields.description: The payment request string to be decoded

fields.name: payment_hash
fields.description: The payment hash

fields.name: value
fields.description: Deprecated, use value_sat or value_msat.

fields.name: creation_date
fields.description: Deprecated, use creation_time_ns

fields.name: fee
fields.description: Deprecated, use fee_sat or fee_msat.

fields.name: payment_preimage
fields.description: The payment preimage

fields.name: value_sat
fields.description: The value of the payment in satoshis

fields.name: value_msat
fields.description: The value of the payment in milli-satoshis

fields.name: payment_request
fields.description: The optional payment request being fulfilled.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the payment.

fields.name: fee_sat
fields.description: The fee paid for this payment in satoshis

fields.name: fee_msat
fields.description: The fee paid for this payment in milli-satoshis

fields.name: creation_time_ns
fields.description: The time in UNIX nanoseconds at which the payment was created.

fields.name: htlcs
fields.description: The HTLCs made in attempt to settle the payment.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: payment_index
fields.description:
The creation index of this payment. Each payment can be uniquely identified
by this index, which may not strictly increment by 1 for payments made in
older versions of lnd.

fields.name: r_hash_str
fields.description:
The hex-encoded payment hash of the invoice to be looked up. The passed
payment hash must be exactly 32 bytes, otherwise an error is returned.
Deprecated now that the REST gateway supports base64 encoding of bytes
fields.

fields.name: r_hash
fields.description:
The payment hash of the invoice to be looked up. When using REST, this field
must be encoded as base64.

fields.name: pub_key
fields.description: The identity pubkey of the peer

fields.name: address
fields.description: Network address of the peer; eg `127.0.0.1:10011`

fields.name: bytes_sent
fields.description: Bytes of data transmitted to this peer

fields.name: bytes_recv
fields.description: Bytes of data transmitted from this peer

fields.name: sat_sent
fields.description: Satoshis sent to this peer

fields.name: sat_recv
fields.description: Satoshis received from this peer

fields.name: inbound
fields.description: A channel is inbound if the counterparty initiated the channel

fields.name: ping_time
fields.description: Ping time to this peer

fields.name: sync_type
fields.description: The type of sync we are currently performing with this peer.

fields.name: features
fields.description: Features advertised by the remote peer in their init message.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: errors
fields.description:
The latest errors received from our peer with timestamps, limited to the 10
most recent errors. These errors are tracked across peer connections, but
are not persisted across lnd restarts. Note that these errors are only
stored for peers that we have channels open with, to prevent peers from
spamming us with errors at no cost.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: flap_count
fields.description:
The number of times we have recorded this peer going offline or coming
online, recorded across restarts. Note that this value is decreased over
time if the peer has not recently flapped, so that we can forgive peers
with historically high flap counts.

fields.name: last_flap_ns
fields.description:
The timestamp of the last flap we observed for this peer. If this value is
zero, we have not observed any flaps for this peer.

fields.name: last_ping_payload
fields.description: The last ping payload the peer has sent to us.

fields.name: pub_key
fields.description: The identity pubkey of the peer.

fields.name: total_limbo_balance
fields.description: The balance in satoshis encumbered in pending channels

fields.name: pending_open_channels
fields.description: Channels pending opening
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: pending_closing_channels
fields.description:
Deprecated: Channels pending closing previously contained cooperatively
closed channels with a single confirmation. These channels are now
considered closed from the time we see them on chain.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: pending_force_closing_channels
fields.description: Channels pending force closing
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: waiting_close_channels
fields.description: Channels waiting for closing tx to confirm
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The pending channel to be closed

fields.name: closing_txid
fields.description: The transaction id of the closing transaction

fields.name: local_txid
fields.description: Hash of the local version of the commitment tx.

fields.name: remote_txid
fields.description: Hash of the remote version of the commitment tx.

fields.name: remote_pending_txid
fields.description: Hash of the remote pending version of the commitment tx.

fields.name: local_commit_fee_sat
fields.description:
The amount in satoshis calculated to be paid in fees for the local
commitment.

fields.name: remote_commit_fee_sat
fields.description:
The amount in satoshis calculated to be paid in fees for the remote
commitment.

fields.name: remote_pending_commit_fee_sat
fields.description:
The amount in satoshis calculated to be paid in fees for the remote
pending commitment.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The pending channel to be force closed

fields.name: closing_txid
fields.description: The transaction id of the closing transaction

fields.name: limbo_balance
fields.description: The balance in satoshis encumbered in this pending channel

fields.name: maturity_height
fields.description: The height at which funds can be swept into the wallet

fields.name: blocks_til_maturity
fields.description:
Remaining # of blocks until the commitment output can be swept.
Negative values indicate how many blocks have passed since becoming
mature.

fields.name: recovered_balance
fields.description: The total value of funds successfully recovered from this channel

fields.name: local_chan_reserve_sat
fields.description:
The minimum satoshis this node is required to reserve in its
balance.

fields.name: remote_chan_reserve_sat
fields.description:
The minimum satoshis the other node is required to reserve in its
balance.

fields.name: initiator
fields.description: The party that initiated opening the channel.

fields.name: commitment_type
fields.description: The commitment type used by this channel.

fields.name: num_forwarding_packages
fields.description: Total number of forwarding packages created in this channel.

fields.name: chan_status_flags
fields.description: A set of flags showing the current state of the channel.

fields.name: private
fields.description: Whether this channel is advertised to the network or not.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The pending channel

fields.name: commit_fee
fields.description:
The amount calculated to be paid in fees for the current set of
commitment transactions. The fee amount is persisted with the channel
in order to allow the fee amount to be removed and recalculated with
each channel state update, including updates that happen after a system
restart.

fields.name: commit_weight
fields.description: The weight of the commitment transaction

fields.name: fee_per_kw
fields.description:
The required number of satoshis per kilo-weight that the requester will
pay at all times, for both the funding transaction and commitment
transaction. This value can later be updated once the channel is open.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The pending channel waiting for closing tx to confirm

fields.name: limbo_balance
fields.description: The balance in satoshis encumbered in this channel

fields.name: commitments
fields.description:
A list of valid commitment transactions. Any of these can confirm at
this point.

fields.name: closing_txid
fields.description: The transaction id of the closing transaction

fields.name: incoming
fields.description: The direction within the channel that the htlc was sent

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The total value of the htlc

fields.name: outpoint
fields.description: The final output to be swept back to the user's wallet

fields.name: maturity_height
fields.description: The next block height at which we can spend the current stage

fields.name: blocks_til_maturity
fields.description:
The number of blocks remaining until the current stage can be swept.
Negative values indicate how many blocks have passed since becoming
mature.

fields.name: stage
fields.description: Indicates whether the htlc is in its first or second stage of recovery

fields.name: global
fields.description: If set, then this update applies to all currently active channels.

fields.name: chan_point
fields.description: If set, this update will target a specific channel.

fields.name: base_fee_msat
fields.description: The base fee charged regardless of the number of milli-satoshis sent.

fields.name: fee_rate
fields.description:
The effective fee rate in milli-satoshis. The precision of this value
goes up to 6 decimal places, so 1e-6.

fields.name: fee_rate_ppm
fields.description: The effective fee rate in micro-satoshis (parts per million).

fields.name: time_lock_delta
fields.description: The required timelock delta for HTLCs forwarded over the channel.

fields.name: max_htlc_msat
fields.description:
If set, the maximum HTLC size in milli-satoshis. If unset, the maximum
HTLC will be unchanged.

fields.name: min_htlc_msat
fields.description:
The minimum HTLC size in milli-satoshis. Only applied if
min_htlc_msat_specified is true.

fields.name: min_htlc_msat_specified
fields.description: If true, min_htlc_msat is applied.

fields.name: failed_updates
fields.description: List of failed policy updates.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: outpoint
fields.description: The outpoint in format txid:n.

fields.name: is_our_output
fields.description:
Denotes if the outpoint is controlled by the internal wallet.
The flag will only detect p2wkh, np2wkh and p2tr inputs as its own.

fields.name: pending_chan_id
fields.description:
A unique identifier of 32 random bytes that will be used as the pending
channel ID to identify the PSBT state machine when interacting with it and
on the wire protocol to initiate the funding request.

fields.name: base_psbt
fields.description:
An optional base PSBT the new channel output will be added to. If this is
non-empty, it must be a binary serialized PSBT.

fields.name: no_publish
fields.description:
If a channel should be part of a batch (multiple channel openings in one
transaction), it can be dangerous if the whole batch transaction is
published too early before all channel opening negotiations are completed.
This flag prevents this particular channel from broadcasting the transaction
after the negotiation with the remote peer. In a batch of channel openings
this flag should be set to true for every channel but the very last.

fields.name: pub_key
fields.description: The 33-byte hex-encoded public key for the payment destination

fields.name: amt
fields.description:
The amount to send expressed in satoshis.

The fields amt and amt_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: amt_msat
fields.description:
The amount to send expressed in millisatoshis.

The fields amt and amt_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: final_cltv_delta
fields.description:
An optional CLTV delta from the current height that should be used for the
timelock of the final hop. Note that unlike SendPayment, QueryRoutes does
not add any additional block padding on top of final_ctlv_delta. This
padding of a few blocks needs to be added manually or otherwise failures may
happen when a block comes in while the payment is in flight.

fields.name: fee_limit
fields.description:
The maximum number of satoshis that will be paid as a fee of the payment.
This value can be represented either as a percentage of the amount being
sent, or as a fixed amount of the maximum fee the user is willing the pay to
send the payment. If not specified, lnd will use a default value of 100%
fees for small amounts (<=1k sat) or 5% fees for larger amounts.

fields.name: ignored_nodes
fields.description:
A list of nodes to ignore during path finding. When using REST, these fields
must be encoded as base64.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: ignored_edges
fields.description: Deprecated. A list of edges to ignore during path finding.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: source_pub_key
fields.description:
The source node where the request route should originated from. If empty,
self is assumed.

fields.name: use_mission_control
fields.description:
If set to true, edge probabilities from mission control will be used to get
the optimal route.

fields.name: ignored_pairs
fields.description: A list of directed node pairs that will be ignored during path finding.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: cltv_limit
fields.description:
An optional maximum total time lock for the route. If the source is empty or
ourselves, this should not exceed lnd's `--max-cltv-expiry` setting. If
zero, then the value of `--max-cltv-expiry` is used as the limit.

fields.name: dest_custom_records
fields.description:
An optional field that can be used to pass an arbitrary set of TLV records
to a peer which understands the new records. This can be used to pass
application specific data during the payment attempt. If the destination
does not support the specified records, an error will be returned.
Record types are required to be in the custom range >= 65536. When using
REST, the values must be encoded as base64.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: outgoing_chan_id
fields.description:
The channel id of the channel that must be taken to the first hop. If zero,
any channel may be used.

fields.name: last_hop_pubkey
fields.description: The pubkey of the last hop of the route. If empty, any hop may be used.

fields.name: route_hints
fields.description: Optional route hints to reach the destination through private channels.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: dest_features
fields.description:
Features assumed to be supported by the final node. All transitive feature
dependencies must also be set properly. For a given feature bit pair, either
optional or remote may be set, but not both. If this field is nil or empty,
the router will try to load destination features from the graph as a
fallback.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: time_pref
fields.description:
The time preference for this payment. Set to -1 to optimize for fees
only, to 1 to optimize for reliability only or a value inbetween for a mix.

fields.name: routes
fields.description:
The route that results from the path finding operation. This is still a
repeated field to retain backwards compatibility.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: success_prob
fields.description:
The success probability of the returned route based on the current mission
control state. [EXPERIMENTAL]

fields.name: method_full_uri
fields.description:
The full URI (in the format /<rpcpackage>.<ServiceName>/MethodName, for
example /lnrpc.Lightning/GetInfo) of the RPC method the message was sent
to/from.

fields.name: stream_rpc
fields.description: Indicates whether the message was sent over a streaming RPC method or not.

fields.name: type_name
fields.description:
The full canonical gRPC name of the message type (in the format
<rpcpackage>.TypeName, for example lnrpc.GetInfoRequest). In case of an
error being returned from lnd, this simply contains the string "error".

fields.name: serialized
fields.description:
The full content of the gRPC message, serialized in the binary protobuf
format.

fields.name: is_error
fields.description:
Indicates that the response from lnd was an error, not a gRPC response. If
this is set to true then the type_name contains the string "error" and
serialized contains the error string.

fields.name: request_id
fields.description:
The unique ID of the intercepted original gRPC request. Useful for mapping
request to response when implementing full duplex message interception. For
streaming requests, this will be the same ID for all incoming and outgoing
middleware intercept messages of the _same_ stream.

fields.name: raw_macaroon
fields.description:
The raw bytes of the complete macaroon as sent by the gRPC client in the
original request. This might be empty for a request that doesn't require
macaroons such as the wallet unlocker RPCs.

fields.name: custom_caveat_condition
fields.description:
The parsed condition of the macaroon's custom caveat for convenient access.
This field only contains the value of the custom caveat that the handling
middleware has registered itself for. The condition _must_ be validated for
messages of intercept_type stream_auth and request!

fields.name: stream_auth
fields.description:
Intercept stream authentication: each new streaming RPC call that is
initiated against lnd and contains the middleware's custom macaroon
caveat can be approved or denied based upon the macaroon in the stream
header. This message will only be sent for streaming RPCs, unary RPCs
must handle the macaroon authentication in the request interception to
avoid an additional message round trip between lnd and the middleware.

fields.name: request
fields.description:
Intercept incoming gRPC client request message: all incoming messages,
both on streaming and unary RPCs, are forwarded to the middleware for
inspection. For unary RPC messages the middleware is also expected to
validate the custom macaroon caveat of the request.

fields.name: response
fields.description:
Intercept outgoing gRPC response message: all outgoing messages, both on
streaming and unary RPCs, are forwarded to the middleware for inspection
and amendment. The response in this message is the original response as
it was generated by the main RPC server. It can either be accepted
(=forwarded to the client), replaced/overwritten with a new message of
the same type, or replaced by an error message.

fields.name: msg_id
fields.description:
The unique message ID of this middleware intercept message. There can be
multiple middleware intercept messages per single gRPC request (one for the
incoming request and one for the outgoing response) or gRPC stream (one for
each incoming message and one for each outgoing response). This message ID
must be referenced when responding (accepting/rejecting/modifying) to an
intercept message.

fields.name: ref_msg_id
fields.description:
The request message ID this response refers to. Must always be set when
giving feedback to an intercept but is ignored for the initial registration
message.

fields.name: register
fields.description:
The registration message identifies the middleware that's being
registered in lnd. The registration message must be sent immediately
after initiating the RegisterRpcMiddleware stream, otherwise lnd will
time out the attempt and terminate the request. NOTE: The middleware
will only receive interception messages for requests that contain a
macaroon with the custom caveat that the middleware declares it is
responsible for handling in the registration message! As a security
measure, _no_ middleware can intercept requests made with _unencumbered_
macaroons!

fields.name: feedback
fields.description:
The middleware received an interception request and gives feedback to
it. The request_id indicates what message the feedback refers to.

fields.name: funding_address
fields.description:
The P2WSH address of the channel funding multisig address that the below
specified amount in satoshis needs to be sent to.

fields.name: funding_amount
fields.description:
The exact amount in satoshis that needs to be sent to the above address to
fund the pending channel.

fields.name: psbt
fields.description:
A raw PSBT that contains the pending channel output. If a base PSBT was
provided in the PsbtShim, this is the base PSBT with one additional output.
If no base PSBT was specified, this is an otherwise empty PSBT with exactly
one output.

fields.name: resolution_type
fields.description: The type of output we are resolving.

fields.name: outcome
fields.description: The outcome of our on chain action that resolved the outpoint.

fields.name: outpoint
fields.description: The outpoint that was spent by the resolution.

fields.name: amount_sat
fields.description: The amount that was claimed by the resolution.

fields.name: sweep_txid
fields.description:
The hex-encoded transaction ID of the sweep transaction that spent the
output.

fields.name: chan_backups
fields.description: The channels to restore as a list of channel/backup pairs.

fields.name: multi_chan_backup
fields.description:
The channels to restore in the packed multi backup format. When using
REST, this field must be encoded as base64.

messages.name: Route
messages.description:
A path through the channel graph which runs over one or more channels in
succession. This struct carries all the information required to craft the
Sphinx onion packet, and send the payment along the first hop in the path. A
route is only selected as valid if all the channels have sufficient capacity to
carry the initial payment amount after fees are accounted for.

fields.name: total_time_lock
fields.description:
The cumulative (final) time lock across the entire route. This is the CLTV
value that should be extended to the first hop in the route. All other hops
will decrement the time-lock as advertised, leaving enough time for all
hops to wait for or present the payment preimage to complete the payment.

fields.name: total_fees
fields.description:
The sum of the fees paid at each hop within the final route. In the case
of a one-hop payment, this value will be zero as we don't need to pay a fee
to ourselves.

fields.name: total_amt
fields.description:
The total amount of funds required to complete a payment over this route.
This value includes the cumulative fees at each hop. As a result, the HTLC
extended to the first-hop in the route will need to have at least this many
satoshis, otherwise the route will fail at an intermediate node due to an
insufficient amount of fees.

fields.name: hops
fields.description: Contains details concerning the specific forwarding details at each hop.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: total_fees_msat
fields.description: The total fees in millisatoshis.

fields.name: total_amt_msat
fields.description: The total amount in millisatoshis.

fields.name: hop_hints
fields.description:
A list of hop hints that when chained together can assist in reaching a
specific destination.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: addr
fields.description: The address to send coins to

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount in satoshis to send

fields.name: target_conf
fields.description:
The target number of blocks that this transaction should be confirmed
by.

fields.name: sat_per_vbyte
fields.description:
A manual fee rate set in sat/vbyte that should be used when crafting the
transaction.

fields.name: sat_per_byte

If set, then the amount field will be ignored, and lnd will attempt to
send all the coins under control of the internal wallet to the specified
address.

The minimum number of confirmations each one of your outputs used for

by.

A manual fee rate set in sat/vbyte that should be used when crafting the

fields.description: An optional label for the transaction, limited to 500 characters.

fields.description:
The minimum number of confirmations each one of your outputs used for

fields.name: spend_unconfirmed

fields.description: The id of the transaction

fields.name: dest
fields.description:
The identity pubkey of the payment recipient. When using REST, this field
must be encoded as base64.

fields.name: dest_string
fields.description:
The hex-encoded identity pubkey of the payment recipient. Deprecated now
that the REST gateway supports base64 encoding of bytes fields.

fields.name: amt
fields.description:
The amount to send expressed in satoshis.

The fields amt and amt_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: amt_msat
fields.description:
The amount to send expressed in millisatoshis.

The fields amt and amt_msat are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: payment_hash
fields.description:
The hash to use within the payment's HTLC. When using REST, this field
must be encoded as base64.

fields.name: payment_hash_string
fields.description:
The hex-encoded hash to use within the payment's HTLC. Deprecated now
that the REST gateway supports base64 encoding of bytes fields.

fields.name: payment_request
fields.description:
A bare-bones invoice for a payment within the Lightning Network. With the
details of the invoice, the sender has all the data necessary to send a
payment to the recipient.

fields.name: final_cltv_delta
fields.description:
The CLTV delta from the current height that should be used to set the
timelock for the final hop.

fields.name: fee_limit
fields.description:
The maximum number of satoshis that will be paid as a fee of the payment.
This value can be represented either as a percentage of the amount being
sent, or as a fixed amount of the maximum fee the user is willing the pay to
send the payment. If not specified, lnd will use a default value of 100%
fees for small amounts (<=1k sat) or 5% fees for larger amounts.

fields.name: outgoing_chan_id
fields.description:
The channel id of the channel that must be taken to the first hop. If zero,
any channel may be used.

fields.name: last_hop_pubkey
fields.description: The pubkey of the last hop of the route. If empty, any hop may be used.

fields.name: cltv_limit
fields.description:
An optional maximum total time lock for the route. This should not exceed
lnd's `--max-cltv-expiry` setting. If zero, then the value of
`--max-cltv-expiry` is enforced.

fields.name: dest_custom_records
fields.description:
An optional field that can be used to pass an arbitrary set of TLV records
to a peer which understands the new records. This can be used to pass
application specific data during the payment attempt. Record types are
required to be in the custom range >= 65536. When using REST, the values
must be encoded as base64.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: allow_self_payment
fields.description: If set, circular payments to self are permitted.

fields.name: dest_features
fields.description:
Features assumed to be supported by the final node. All transitive feature
dependencies must also be set properly. For a given feature bit pair, either
optional or remote may be set, but not both. If this field is nil or empty,
the router will try to load destination features from the graph as a
fallback.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: payment_addr

fields.name: payment_hash_string

fields.name: single_hash

only use one round of hashing instead.

services.name: Lightning
services.description: Lightning is the main RPC server of the daemon.

methods.name: WalletBalance
methods.description:
lncli: `walletbalance`
WalletBalance returns total unspent outputs(confirmed and unconfirmed), all
confirmed unspent outputs and all unconfirmed unspent outputs under control
of the wallet.

details.summary:
lncli: `walletbalance`
WalletBalance returns total unspent outputs(confirmed and unconfirmed), all
confirmed unspent outputs and all unconfirmed unspent outputs under control
of the wallet.

methods.name: ChannelBalance
methods.description:
lncli: `channelbalance`
ChannelBalance returns a report on the total funds across all open channels,
categorized in local/remote, pending local/remote and unsettled local/remote
balances.

details.summary:
lncli: `channelbalance`
ChannelBalance returns a report on the total funds across all open channels,
categorized in local/remote, pending local/remote and unsettled local/remote
balances.

methods.name: GetTransactions
methods.description:
lncli: `listchaintxns`
GetTransactions returns a list describing all the known transactions
relevant to the wallet.

parameters.description:
The height from which to list transactions, inclusive. If this value is
greater than end_height, transactions will be read in reverse.
parameters.name: start_height

parameters.description:
The height until which to list transactions, inclusive. To include
unconfirmed transactions, this value should be set to -1, which will
return transactions from start_height until the current chain tip and
unconfirmed transactions. If no end_height is provided, the call will
default to this option.
parameters.name: end_height

parameters.description: An optional filter to only include transactions relevant to an account.
parameters.name: account

details.summary:
lncli: `listchaintxns`
GetTransactions returns a list describing all the known transactions
relevant to the wallet.

methods.name: EstimateFee
methods.description:
lncli: `estimatefee`
EstimateFee asks the chain backend to estimate the fee rate and total fees
for a transaction that pays to multiple specified outputs.

When using REST, the `AddrToAmount` map type can be set by appending
`&AddrToAmount[<address>]=<amount_to_send>` to the URL. Unfortunately this
map type doesn't appear in the REST API documentation because of a bug in
the grpc-gateway library.

details.description:

`&AddrToAmount[<address>]=<amount_to_send>` to the URL. Unfortunately this
map type doesn't appear in the REST API documentation because of a bug in
the grpc-gateway library.

methods.name: SendCoins
methods.description:
lncli: `sendcoins`
SendCoins executes a request to send coins to a particular address. Unlike
SendMany, this RPC call only allows creating a single output at a time. If
neither target_conf, or sat_per_vbyte are set, then the internal wallet will
consult its fee model to determine a fee for the default confirmation
target.

SendMany, this RPC call only allows creating a single output at a time. If
neither target_conf, or sat_per_vbyte are set, then the internal wallet will
consult its fee model to determine a fee for the default confirmation
target.

methods.name: SendMany
methods.description:
lncli: `sendmany`
SendMany handles a request for a transaction that creates multiple specified
outputs in parallel. If neither target_conf, or sat_per_vbyte are set, then
the internal wallet will consult its fee model to determine a fee for the
default confirmation target.

SendMany handles a request for a transaction that creates multiple specified
outputs in parallel. If neither target_conf, or sat_per_vbyte are set, then

methods.name: NewAddress
methods.description:
lncli: `newaddress`
NewAddress creates a new address under control of the local wallet.

parameters.description: The type of address to generate.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description:
The name of the account to generate a new address for. If empty, the
default wallet account is used.
parameters.name: account

details.summary:
lncli: `newaddress`
NewAddress creates a new address under control of the local wallet.

methods.name: SignMessage
methods.description:
lncli: `signmessage`
SignMessage signs a message with this node's private key. The returned
signature string is `zbase32` encoded and pubkey recoverable, meaning that
only the message digest and signature are needed for verification.

details.summary:
lncli: `signmessage`
SignMessage signs a message with this node's private key. The returned
signature string is `zbase32` encoded and pubkey recoverable, meaning that
only the message digest and signature are needed for verification.

methods.name: VerifyMessage
methods.description:
lncli: `verifymessage`
VerifyMessage verifies a signature over a msg. The signature must be
zbase32 encoded and signed by an active node in the resident node's
channel database. In addition to returning the validity of the signature,
VerifyMessage also returns the recovered pubkey from the signature.

details.summary:
lncli: `verifymessage`
VerifyMessage verifies a signature over a msg. The signature must be
zbase32 encoded and signed by an active node in the resident node's
channel database. In addition to returning the validity of the signature,
VerifyMessage also returns the recovered pubkey from the signature.

methods.name: ConnectPeer
methods.description:
lncli: `connect`
ConnectPeer attempts to establish a connection to a remote peer. This is at
the networking level, and is used for communication between nodes. This is
distinct from establishing a channel with a peer.

details.summary:
lncli: `connect`
ConnectPeer attempts to establish a connection to a remote peer. This is at
the networking level, and is used for communication between nodes. This is
distinct from establishing a channel with a peer.

methods.name: DisconnectPeer
methods.description:
lncli: `disconnect`
DisconnectPeer attempts to disconnect one peer from another identified by a
given pubKey. In the case that we currently have a pending or active channel
with the target peer, then this action will be not be allowed.

parameters.description: The pubkey of the node to disconnect from
parameters.name: pub_key

details.summary:
lncli: `disconnect`
DisconnectPeer attempts to disconnect one peer from another identified by a
given pubKey. In the case that we currently have a pending or active channel
with the target peer, then this action will be not be allowed.

methods.name: ListPeers
methods.description:
lncli: `listpeers`
ListPeers returns a verbose listing of all currently active peers.

parameters.description:
If true, only the last error that our peer sent us will be returned with
the peer's information, rather than the full set of historic errors we have
stored.
parameters.name: latest_error

details.summary:
lncli: `listpeers`
ListPeers returns a verbose listing of all currently active peers.

methods.name: SubscribePeerEvents
methods.description:
SubscribePeerEvents creates a uni-directional stream from the server to
the client in which any events relevant to the state of peers are sent
over. Events include peers going online and offline.

details.summary:
SubscribePeerEvents creates a uni-directional stream from the server to
the client in which any events relevant to the state of peers are sent

methods.name: GetInfo
methods.description:
lncli: `getinfo`
GetInfo returns general information concerning the lightning node including
it's identity pubkey, alias, the chains it is connected to, and information
concerning the number of open+pending channels.

details.summary:
lncli: `getinfo`
GetInfo returns general information concerning the lightning node including
it's identity pubkey, alias, the chains it is connected to, and information
concerning the number of open+pending channels.

methods.name: GetRecoveryInfo
methods.description:
lncli: `getrecoveryinfo`
GetRecoveryInfo returns information concerning the recovery mode including
whether it's in a recovery mode, whether the recovery is finished, and the
progress made so far.

details.summary:
* lncli: `getrecoveryinfo`
GetRecoveryInfo returns information concerning the recovery mode including

progress made so far.

methods.name: PendingChannels
methods.description:
lncli: `pendingchannels`
PendingChannels returns a list of all the channels that are currently
considered "pending". A channel is pending if it has finished the funding
workflow and is waiting for confirmations for the funding txn, or is in the
process of closure, either initiated cooperatively or non-cooperatively.

details.summary:
lncli: `pendingchannels`
PendingChannels returns a list of all the channels that are currently
considered "pending". A channel is pending if it has finished the funding
workflow and is waiting for confirmations for the funding txn, or is in the
process of closure, either initiated cooperatively or non-cooperatively.

methods.name: ListChannels
methods.description:
lncli: `listchannels`
ListChannels returns a description of all the open channels that this node
is a participant in.

parameters.description:
Filters the response for channels with a target peer's pubkey. If peer is
empty, all channels will be returned.
parameters.name: peer

details.summary:
lncli: `listchannels`
ListChannels returns a description of all the open channels that this node
is a participant in.

methods.description:
SubscribeChannelEvents creates a uni-directional stream from the server to
the client in which any updates relevant to the state of the channels are
sent over. Events include new active channels, inactive channels, and closed
channels.

details.summary:
SubscribeChannelEvents creates a uni-directional stream from the server to
the client in which any updates relevant to the state of the channels are
sent over. Events include new active channels, inactive channels, and closed

methods.name: ClosedChannels

ClosedChannels returns a description of all the closed channels that
this node was a participant in.

lncli: `closedchannels`
ClosedChannels returns a description of all the closed channels that

methods.name: OpenChannelSync
methods.description:
OpenChannelSync is a synchronous version of the OpenChannel RPC call. This
call is meant to be consumed by clients to the REST proxy. As with all
other sync calls, all byte slices are intended to be populated as hex
encoded strings.

details.summary:
OpenChannelSync is a synchronous version of the OpenChannel RPC call. This
call is meant to be consumed by clients to the REST proxy. As with all
other sync calls, all byte slices are intended to be populated as hex
encoded strings.

methods.name: OpenChannel
methods.description:
lncli: `openchannel`
OpenChannel attempts to open a singly funded channel specified in the
request to a remote peer. Users are able to specify a target number of
blocks that the funding transaction should be confirmed in, or a manual fee
rate to us for the funding transaction. If neither are specified, then a
lax block confirmation target is used. Each OpenStatusUpdate will return
the pending channel ID of the in-progress channel. Depending on the
arguments specified in the OpenChannelRequest, this pending channel ID can
then be used to manually progress the channel funding flow.

details.summary:
lncli: `openchannel`
OpenChannel attempts to open a singly funded channel specified in the
request to a remote peer. Users are able to specify a target number of
blocks that the funding transaction should be confirmed in, or a manual fee
rate to us for the funding transaction. If neither are specified, then a
lax block confirmation target is used. Each OpenStatusUpdate will return
the pending channel ID of the in-progress channel. Depending on the
arguments specified in the OpenChannelRequest, this pending channel ID can
then be used to manually progress the channel funding flow.

methods.name: BatchOpenChannel
methods.description:
lncli: `batchopenchannel`
BatchOpenChannel attempts to open multiple single-funded channels in a
single transaction in an atomic way. This means either all channel open
requests succeed at once or all attempts are aborted if any of them fail.
This is the safer variant of using PSBTs to manually fund a batch of
channels through the OpenChannel RPC.

details.summary:
lncli: `batchopenchannel`
BatchOpenChannel attempts to open multiple single-funded channels in a
single transaction in an atomic way. This means either all channel open
requests succeed at once or all attempts are aborted if any of them fail.
This is the safer variant of using PSBTs to manually fund a batch of
channels through the OpenChannel RPC.

methods.name: FundingStateStep
methods.description:
FundingStateStep is an advanced funding related call that allows the caller
to either execute some preparatory steps for a funding workflow, or
manually progress a funding workflow. The primary way a funding flow is
identified is via its pending channel ID. As an example, this method can be
used to specify that we're expecting a funding flow for a particular
pending channel ID, for which we need to use specific parameters.
Alternatively, this can be used to interactively drive PSBT signing for
funding for partially complete funding transactions.

details.summary:
FundingStateStep is an advanced funding related call that allows the caller
to either execute some preparatory steps for a funding workflow, or
manually progress a funding workflow. The primary way a funding flow is
identified is via its pending channel ID. As an example, this method can be
used to specify that we're expecting a funding flow for a particular
pending channel ID, for which we need to use specific parameters.
Alternatively, this can be used to interactively drive PSBT signing for
funding for partially complete funding transactions.

methods.name: ChannelAcceptor
methods.description:
ChannelAcceptor dispatches a bi-directional streaming RPC in which
OpenChannel requests are sent to the client and the client responds with
a boolean that tells LND whether or not to accept the channel. This allows
node operators to specify their own criteria for accepting inbound channels
through a single persistent connection.

parameters.description: (streaming inputs)
parameters.name: body

details.summary:
ChannelAcceptor dispatches a bi-directional streaming RPC in which
OpenChannel requests are sent to the client and the client responds with
a boolean that tells LND whether or not to accept the channel. This allows
node operators to specify their own criteria for accepting inbound channels
through a single persistent connection.

methods.name: CloseChannel
methods.description:
lncli: `closechannel`
CloseChannel attempts to close an active channel identified by its channel
outpoint (ChannelPoint). The actions of this method can additionally be
augmented to attempt a force close after a timeout period in the case of an
inactive peer. If a non-force close (cooperative closure) is requested,
then the user can specify either a target number of blocks until the
closure transaction is confirmed, or a manual fee rate. If neither are
specified, then a default lax, block confirmation target is used.

parameters.description:
Hex-encoded string representing the byte-reversed hash of the funding
transaction.
parameters.name: channel_point.funding_txid_str

parameters.description: The index of the output of the funding transaction
parameters.name: channel_point.output_index

parameters.description:
Txid of the funding transaction. When using REST, this field must be
encoded as base64.
parameters.name: channel_point.funding_txid_bytes

parameters.description:
If true, then the channel will be closed forcibly. This means the
current commitment transaction will be signed and broadcast.
parameters.name: force

parameters.description:
The target number of blocks that the closure transaction should be
confirmed by.
parameters.name: target_conf

parameters.description:
Deprecated, use sat_per_vbyte.
A manual fee rate set in sat/vbyte that should be used when crafting the
closure transaction.
parameters.name: sat_per_byte

parameters.description:
An optional address to send funds to in the case of a cooperative close.
If the channel was opened with an upfront shutdown script and this field
is set, the request to close will fail because the channel must pay out
to the upfront shutdown addresss.
parameters.name: delivery_address

parameters.description:
A manual fee rate set in sat/vbyte that should be used when crafting the
closure transaction.
parameters.name: sat_per_vbyte

details.summary:
lncli: `closechannel`
CloseChannel attempts to close an active channel identified by its channel
outpoint (ChannelPoint). The actions of this method can additionally be
augmented to attempt a force close after a timeout period in the case of an
inactive peer. If a non-force close (cooperative closure) is requested,
then the user can specify either a target number of blocks until the
closure transaction is confirmed, or a manual fee rate. If neither are
specified, then a default lax, block confirmation target is used.

methods.name: AbandonChannel
methods.description:
lncli: `abandonchannel`
AbandonChannel removes all channel state from the database except for a
close summary. This method can be used to get rid of permanently unusable
channels due to bugs fixed in newer versions of lnd. This method can also be
used to remove externally funded channels where the funding transaction was
never broadcast. Only available for non-externally funded channels in dev
build.

parameters.description:
Hex-encoded string representing the byte-reversed hash of the funding
transaction.
parameters.name: channel_point.funding_txid_str

parameters.description: The index of the output of the funding transaction
parameters.name: channel_point.output_index

parameters.description:
Txid of the funding transaction. When using REST, this field must be
encoded as base64.
parameters.name: channel_point.funding_txid_bytes

parameters.description:
Override the requirement for being in dev mode by setting this to true and
confirming the user knows what they are doing and this is a potential foot
gun to lose funds if used on active channels.
parameters.name: i_know_what_i_am_doing

details.summary:
lncli: `abandonchannel`
AbandonChannel removes all channel state from the database except for a
close summary. This method can be used to get rid of permanently unusable
channels due to bugs fixed in newer versions of lnd. This method can also be
used to remove externally funded channels where the funding transaction was
never broadcast. Only available for non-externally funded channels in dev
build.

methods.name: SendPayment
methods.description:
lncli: `sendpayment`
Deprecated, use routerrpc.SendPaymentV2. SendPayment dispatches a
bi-directional streaming RPC for sending payments through the Lightning
Network. A single RPC invocation creates a persistent bi-directional
stream allowing clients to rapidly send payments through the Lightning
Network with a single persistent connection.

parameters.description: (streaming inputs)
parameters.name: body

details.summary:
lncli: `sendpayment`
Deprecated, use routerrpc.SendPaymentV2. SendPayment dispatches a
bi-directional streaming RPC for sending payments through the Lightning
Network. A single RPC invocation creates a persistent bi-directional
stream allowing clients to rapidly send payments through the Lightning
Network with a single persistent connection.

methods.name: SendPaymentSync
methods.description:
SendPaymentSync is the synchronous non-streaming version of SendPayment.
This RPC is intended to be consumed by clients of the REST proxy.
Additionally, this RPC expects the destination's public key and the payment
hash (if any) to be encoded as hex strings.

details.summary:
SendPaymentSync is the synchronous non-streaming version of SendPayment.
This RPC is intended to be consumed by clients of the REST proxy.
Additionally, this RPC expects the destination's public key and the payment
hash (if any) to be encoded as hex strings.

methods.name: SendToRoute
methods.description:
lncli: `sendtoroute`
Deprecated, use routerrpc.SendToRouteV2. SendToRoute is a bi-directional
streaming RPC for sending payment through the Lightning Network. This
method differs from SendPayment in that it allows users to specify a full
route manually. This can be used for things like rebalancing, and atomic
swaps.

methods.name: SendToRouteSync
methods.description:
SendToRouteSync is a synchronous version of SendToRoute. It Will block
until the payment either fails or succeeds.

details.summary:
SendToRouteSync is a synchronous version of SendToRoute. It Will block
until the payment either fails or succeeds.

methods.name: AddInvoice
methods.description:
lncli: `addinvoice`
AddInvoice attempts to add a new invoice to the invoice database. Any
duplicated invoices are rejected, therefore all invoices *must* have a
unique payment preimage.

details.summary:
lncli: `addinvoice`
AddInvoice attempts to add a new invoice to the invoice database. Any
duplicated invoices are rejected, therefore all invoices *must* have a
unique payment preimage.

methods.name: ListInvoices
methods.description:
lncli: `listinvoices`
ListInvoices returns a list of all the invoices currently stored within the
database. Any active debug invoices are ignored. It has full support for
paginated responses, allowing users to query for specific invoices through
their add_index. This can be done by using either the first_index_offset or
last_index_offset fields included in the response as the index_offset of the
next request. By default, the first 100 invoices created will be returned.
Backwards pagination is also supported through the Reversed flag.

parameters.description:
If set, only invoices that are not settled and not canceled will be returned
in the response.
parameters.name: pending_only

parameters.description:
The index of an invoice that will be used as either the start or end of a
query to determine which invoices should be returned in the response.
parameters.name: index_offset

parameters.description: The max number of invoices to return in the response to this query.
parameters.name: num_max_invoices

parameters.description:
If set, the invoices returned will result from seeking backwards from the
specified index offset. This can be used to paginate backwards.
parameters.name: reversed

details.summary:
lncli: `listinvoices`
ListInvoices returns a list of all the invoices currently stored within the
database. Any active debug invoices are ignored. It has full support for
paginated responses, allowing users to query for specific invoices through

Backwards pagination is also supported through the Reversed flag.

methods.name: LookupInvoice
methods.description:
lncli: `lookupinvoice`
LookupInvoice attempts to look up an invoice according to its payment hash.
The passed payment hash *must* be exactly 32 bytes, if not, an error is
returned.

parameters.description:
The hex-encoded payment hash of the invoice to be looked up. The passed
payment hash must be exactly 32 bytes, otherwise an error is returned.
Deprecated now that the REST gateway supports base64 encoding of bytes
fields.
parameters.name: r_hash_str

parameters.description:
The payment hash of the invoice to be looked up. When using REST, this field
must be encoded as base64.
parameters.name: r_hash

details.summary:
lncli: `lookupinvoice`
LookupInvoice attempts to look up an invoice according to its payment hash.
The passed payment hash *must* be exactly 32 bytes, if not, an error is
returned.

methods.name: SubscribeInvoices
methods.description:
SubscribeInvoices returns a uni-directional stream (server -> client) for
notifying the client of newly added/settled invoices. The caller can
optionally specify the add_index and/or the settle_index. If the add_index
is specified, then we'll first start by sending add invoice events for all
invoices with an add_index greater than the specified value. If the
settle_index is specified, the next, we'll send out all settle events for
invoices with a settle_index greater than the specified value. One or both
of these fields can be set. If no fields are set, then we'll only send out
the latest add/settle events.

parameters.description:
If specified (non-zero), then we'll first start by sending out
notifications for all added indexes with an add_index greater than this
value. This allows callers to catch up on any events they missed while they
weren't connected to the streaming RPC.
parameters.name: add_index

parameters.description:
If specified (non-zero), then we'll first start by sending out
notifications for all settled indexes with an settle_index greater than
this value. This allows callers to catch up on any events they missed while
they weren't connected to the streaming RPC.
parameters.name: settle_index

details.summary:
SubscribeInvoices returns a uni-directional stream (server -> client) for
notifying the client of newly added/settled invoices. The caller can
optionally specify the add_index and/or the settle_index. If the add_index
is specified, then we'll first start by sending add invoice events for all
invoices with an add_index greater than the specified value. If the
settle_index is specified, the next, we'll send out all settle events for
invoices with a settle_index greater than the specified value. One or both
of these fields can be set. If no fields are set, then we'll only send out
the latest add/settle events.

methods.name: ListPayments
methods.description:
lncli: `listpayments`
ListPayments returns a list of all outgoing payments.

parameters.description:
If true, then return payments that have not yet fully completed. This means
that pending payments, as well as failed payments will show up if this
field is set to true. This flag doesn't change the meaning of the indices,
which are tied to individual payments.
parameters.name: include_incomplete

parameters.description:
The index of a payment that will be used as either the start or end of a
query to determine which payments should be returned in the response. The
index_offset is exclusive. In the case of a zero index_offset, the query
will start with the oldest payment when paginating forwards, or will end
with the most recent payment when paginating backwards.
parameters.name: index_offset

parameters.description: The maximal number of payments returned in the response to this query.
parameters.name: max_payments

parameters.description:
If set, the payments returned will result from seeking backwards from the
specified index offset. This can be used to paginate backwards. The order
of the returned payments is always oldest first (ascending index order).
parameters.name: reversed

parameters.description:
If set, all payments (complete and incomplete, independent of the
max_payments parameter) will be counted. Note that setting this to true will
increase the run time of the call significantly on systems that have a lot
of payments, as all of them have to be iterated through to be counted.
parameters.name: count_total_payments

details.summary:
lncli: `listpayments`
ListPayments returns a list of all outgoing payments.

methods.name: DescribeGraph
methods.description:
lncli: `describegraph`
DescribeGraph returns a description of the latest graph state from the
point of view of the node. The graph information is partitioned into two
components: all the nodes/vertexes, and all the edges that connect the
vertexes themselves. As this is a directed graph, the edges also contain
the node directional specific routing policy which includes: the time lock
delta, fee information, etc.

parameters.description:
Whether unannounced channels are included in the response or not. If set,
unannounced channels are included. Unannounced channels are both private
channels, and public channels that are not yet announced to the network.
parameters.name: include_unannounced

details.summary:

components: all the nodes/vertexes, and all the edges that connect the
vertexes themselves. As this is a directed graph, the edges also contain
the node directional specific routing policy which includes: the time lock
delta, fee information, etc.

methods.name: QueryRoutes
methods.description:
lncli: `queryroutes`
QueryRoutes attempts to query the daemon's Channel Router for a possible
route to a target destination capable of carrying a specific amount of
satoshis. The returned route contains the full details required to craft and
send an HTLC, also including the necessary information that should be
present within the Sphinx packet encapsulated within the HTLC.

When using REST, the `dest_custom_records` map type can be set by appending
`&dest_custom_records[<record_number>]=<record_data_base64_url_encoded>`
to the URL. Unfortunately this map type doesn't appear in the REST API
documentation because of a bug in the grpc-gateway library.

details.description:
When using REST, the `dest_custom_records` map type can be set by appending
`&dest_custom_records[<record_number>]=<record_data_base64_url_encoded>`
to the URL. Unfortunately this map type doesn't appear in the REST API
documentation because of a bug in the grpc-gateway library.

parameters.description: The 33-byte hex-encoded public key for the payment destination
parameters.name: pub_key

parameters.description:
The amount to send expressed in satoshis.

The fields amt and amt_msat are mutually exclusive.
parameters.name: amt

parameters.description:
The amount to send expressed in millisatoshis.

The fields amt and amt_msat are mutually exclusive.
parameters.name: amt_msat

parameters.description:
An optional CLTV delta from the current height that should be used for the
timelock of the final hop. Note that unlike SendPayment, QueryRoutes does
not add any additional block padding on top of final_ctlv_delta. This
padding of a few blocks needs to be added manually or otherwise failures may
happen when a block comes in while the payment is in flight.
parameters.name: final_cltv_delta

parameters.description:
The fee limit expressed as a fixed amount of satoshis.

The fields fixed and fixed_msat are mutually exclusive.
parameters.name: fee_limit.fixed

parameters.description:
The fee limit expressed as a fixed amount of millisatoshis.

The fields fixed and fixed_msat are mutually exclusive.
parameters.name: fee_limit.fixed_msat

parameters.description: The fee limit expressed as a percentage of the payment amount.
parameters.name: fee_limit.percent

parameters.description:
A list of nodes to ignore during path finding. When using REST, these fields
must be encoded as base64.
parameters.name: ignored_nodes

parameters.description:
The source node where the request route should originated from. If empty,
self is assumed.
parameters.name: source_pub_key

parameters.description:
If set to true, edge probabilities from mission control will be used to get
the optimal route.
parameters.name: use_mission_control

parameters.description:
An optional maximum total time lock for the route. If the source is empty or
ourselves, this should not exceed lnd's `--max-cltv-expiry` setting. If
zero, then the value of `--max-cltv-expiry` is used as the limit.
parameters.name: cltv_limit

parameters.description:
The channel id of the channel that must be taken to the first hop. If zero,
any channel may be used.
parameters.name: outgoing_chan_id

parameters.description: The pubkey of the last hop of the route. If empty, any hop may be used.
parameters.name: last_hop_pubkey

parameters.description:
Features assumed to be supported by the final node. All transitive feature
dependencies must also be set properly. For a given feature bit pair, either
optional or remote may be set, but not both. If this field is nil or empty,
the router will try to load destination features from the graph as a
fallback.
parameters.name: dest_features

parameters.description:
The time preference for this payment. Set to -1 to optimize for fees
only, to 1 to optimize for reliability only or a value inbetween for a mix.
parameters.name: time_pref

details.summary:
lncli: `queryroutes`
QueryRoutes attempts to query the daemon's Channel Router for a possible
route to a target destination capable of carrying a specific amount of
satoshis. The returned route contains the full details required to craft and
send an HTLC, also including the necessary information that should be
present within the Sphinx packet encapsulated within the HTLC.

methods.name: SubscribeChannelGraph
methods.description:
SubscribeChannelGraph launches a streaming RPC that allows the caller to
receive notifications upon any changes to the channel graph topology from
the point of view of the responding node. Events notified include: new
nodes coming online, nodes updating their authenticated attributes, new
channels being advertised, updates in the routing policy for a directional
channel edge, and when channels are closed on-chain.

details.summary:

receive notifications upon any changes to the channel graph topology from
the point of view of the responding node. Events notified include: new
nodes coming online, nodes updating their authenticated attributes, new
channels being advertised, updates in the routing policy for a directional
channel edge, and when channels are closed on-chain.

lncli: `debuglevel`
DebugLevel allows a caller to programmatically set the logging verbosity of
lnd. The logging can be targeted according to a coarse daemon-wide logging
level, or in a granular fashion to specify the logging for a target
sub-system.

lncli: `updatechanpolicy`

methods.name: ForwardingHistory
methods.description:
lncli: `fwdinghistory`
ForwardingHistory allows the caller to query the htlcswitch for a record of
all HTLCs forwarded within the target time range, and integer offset
within that time range, for a maximum number of events. If no maximum number
of events is specified, up to 100 events will be returned. If no time-range
is specified, then events will be returned in the order that they occured.

A list of forwarding events are returned. The size of each forwarding event
is 40 bytes, and the max message size able to be returned in gRPC is 4 MiB.
As a result each message can only contain 50k entries. Each response has
the index offset of the last entry. The index offset can be provided to the
request to allow the caller to skip a series of records.

details.description:
A list of forwarding events are returned. The size of each forwarding event
is 40 bytes, and the max message size able to be returned in gRPC is 4 MiB.
As a result each message can only contain 50k entries. Each response has
the index offset of the last entry. The index offset can be provided to the
request to allow the caller to skip a series of records.
details.summary:
lncli: `fwdinghistory`
ForwardingHistory allows the caller to query the htlcswitch for a record of

within that time range, for a maximum number of events. If no maximum number
of events is specified, up to 100 events will be returned. If no time-range
is specified, then events will be returned in the order that they occured.

methods.name: ExportChannelBackup
methods.description:
lncli: `exportchanbackup`
ExportChannelBackup attempts to return an encrypted static channel backup
for the target channel identified by it channel point. The backup is
encrypted with a key generated from the aezeed seed of the user. The
returned backup can either be restored using the RestoreChannelBackup
method once lnd is running, or via the InitWallet and UnlockWallet methods
from the WalletUnlocker service.

parameters.description:
Hex-encoded string representing the byte-reversed hash of the funding
transaction.
parameters.name: chan_point.funding_txid_str

parameters.description: The index of the output of the funding transaction
parameters.name: chan_point.output_index

parameters.description:
Txid of the funding transaction. When using REST, this field must be
encoded as base64.
parameters.name: chan_point.funding_txid_bytes

details.summary:
lncli: `exportchanbackup`
ExportChannelBackup attempts to return an encrypted static channel backup
for the target channel identified by it channel point. The backup is
encrypted with a key generated from the aezeed seed of the user. The
returned backup can either be restored using the RestoreChannelBackup
method once lnd is running, or via the InitWallet and UnlockWallet methods
from the WalletUnlocker service.

methods.name: ExportAllChannelBackups
methods.description:
ExportAllChannelBackups returns static channel backups for all existing
channels known to lnd. A set of regular singular static channel backups for
each channel are returned. Additionally, a multi-channel backup is returned
as well, which contains a single encrypted blob containing the backups of
each channel.

details.summary:
ExportAllChannelBackups returns static channel backups for all existing
channels known to lnd. A set of regular singular static channel backups for
each channel are returned. Additionally, a multi-channel backup is returned
as well, which contains a single encrypted blob containing the backups of
each channel.

methods.name: VerifyChanBackup
methods.description:
VerifyChanBackup allows a caller to verify the integrity of a channel backup
snapshot. This method will accept either a packed Single or a packed Multi.
Specifying both will result in an error.

details.summary:
VerifyChanBackup allows a caller to verify the integrity of a channel backup
snapshot. This method will accept either a packed Single or a packed Multi.
Specifying both will result in an error.

methods.name: RestoreChannelBackups
methods.description:
lncli: `restorechanbackup`
RestoreChannelBackups accepts a set of singular channel backups, or a
single encrypted multi-chan backup and attempts to recover any funds
remaining within the channel. If we are able to unpack the backup, then the
new channel will be shown under listchannels, as well as pending channels.

details.summary:
lncli: `restorechanbackup`
RestoreChannelBackups accepts a set of singular channel backups, or a
single encrypted multi-chan backup and attempts to recover any funds
remaining within the channel. If we are able to unpack the backup, then the
new channel will be shown under listchannels, as well as pending channels.

methods.name: SubscribeChannelBackups
methods.description:
SubscribeChannelBackups allows a client to sub-subscribe to the most up to
date information concerning the state of all channel backups. Each time a
new channel is added, we return the new set of channels, along with a
multi-chan backup containing the backup info for all channels. Each time a
channel is closed, we send a new update, which contains new new chan back
ups, but the updated set of encrypted multi-chan backups with the closed
channel(s) removed.

details.summary:

ups, but the updated set of encrypted multi-chan backups with the closed
channel(s) removed.

methods.name: RegisterRPCMiddleware
methods.description:
RegisterRPCMiddleware adds a new gRPC middleware to the interceptor chain. A
gRPC middleware is software component external to lnd that aims to add
additional business logic to lnd by observing/intercepting/validating
incoming gRPC client requests and (if needed) replacing/overwriting outgoing
messages before they're sent to the client. When registering the middleware
must identify itself and indicate what custom macaroon caveats it wants to
be responsible for. Only requests that contain a macaroon with that specific
custom caveat are then sent to the middleware for inspection. The other
option is to register for the read-only mode in which all requests/responses
are forwarded for interception to the middleware but the middleware is not
allowed to modify any responses. As a security measure, _no_ middleware can
modify responses for requests made with _unencumbered_ macaroons!

details.summary:
RegisterRPCMiddleware adds a new gRPC middleware to the interceptor chain. A
gRPC middleware is software component external to lnd that aims to add
additional business logic to lnd by observing/intercepting/validating
incoming gRPC client requests and (if needed) replacing/overwriting outgoing
messages before they're sent to the client. When registering the middleware
must identify itself and indicate what custom macaroon caveats it wants to
be responsible for. Only requests that contain a macaroon with that specific
custom caveat are then sent to the middleware for inspection. The other
option is to register for the read-only mode in which all requests/responses
are forwarded for interception to the middleware but the middleware is not
allowed to modify any responses. As a security measure, _no_ middleware can
modify responses for requests made with _unencumbered_ macaroons!

The fee rate, in satoshis per vbyte, that will be used by watchtowers for
justice transactions in response to channel breaches.

fields.name: pubkey
fields.description: The identifying public key of the watchtower to remove.

fields.name: address
fields.description:
If set, then the record for this address will be removed, indicating that is
is stale. Otherwise, the watchtower will no longer be used for future
session negotiations and backups.

fields.name: num_backups
fields.description:
The total number of backups made to all active and exhausted watchtower
sessions.

fields.name: num_pending_backups
fields.description:
The total number of backups that are pending to be acknowledged by all
active and exhausted watchtower sessions.

fields.name: num_failed_backups
fields.description:
